revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-01 10:10:04.000000000', 'message': "Avoid shadowing Exception 'message' attribute

The Exception class has a 'message' attribute:

  >>> Exception('foo').message
  'foo'

however, we follow a pattern that results in the attribute being
shadowed by a class attribute:

  >>> class MyException(Exception):
  ...     message = 'Foo %s'
  ...     def __init__(self, bar):
  ...         message = self.message % bar
  ...         super(MyException, self).__init__(message)
  ...
  >>> MyException('bar').message
  'Foo %s'

whereas, we obviously want behaviour like this:

  >>> class MyException(Exception):
  ...     msg_fmt = 'Foo %s'
  ...     def __init__(self, bar):
  ...         message = self.msg_fmt % bar
  ...         super(MyException, self).__init__(message)
  ...
  >>> MyException('bar').message
  'Foo bar'

Avoid this shadowing by using 'msg_fmt' as the name of the class
attribute. Add a test which fails without this fix.

Change-Id: I304f31edec20b1293cf6c8de931415590fde6752

commit_message:
Avoid shadowing Exception 'message' attribute

The Exception class has a 'message' attribute:

  >>> Exception('foo').message
  'foo'

however, we follow a pattern that results in the attribute being
shadowed by a class attribute:

  >>> class MyException(Exception):
  ...     message = 'Foo %s'
  ...     def __init__(self, bar):
  ...         message = self.message % bar
  ...         super(MyException, self).__init__(message)
  ...
  >>> MyException('bar').message
  'Foo %s'

whereas, we obviously want behaviour like this:

  >>> class MyException(Exception):
  ...     msg_fmt = 'Foo %s'
  ...     def __init__(self, bar):
  ...         message = self.msg_fmt % bar
  ...         super(MyException, self).__init__(message)
  ...
  >>> MyException('bar').message
  'Foo bar'

Avoid this shadowing by using 'msg_fmt' as the name of the class
attribute. Add a test which fails without this fix.

Change-Id: I304f31edec20b1293cf6c8de931415590fde6752

commit_message:
Adds sample config file generation script

Having this script placed in oslo will let projects avoid implementing
their own sample generation script.

Change-Id: Ifed266ef65aee72da2e16ff30b7bde1e834650da

subject: Raise an exception when _oparser is not initialized
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-02 16:37:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks Dims

I'm not sure it makes sense to allow printing usage/help before you invoke the ConfigOpts object ... i.e. before all CLI options are known to be registered

Would need to understand the use case better

In the interim, I'd say calling print_usage/help() before __call__() should raise an exception and clear() should just set oparser to None"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-02 16:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

By "raise an exception", I mean something better than AttributeError :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-02 16:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
Raise an exception when _oparser is not initialized

Throw an exception when print_help and print_usage
are called before __call__() is invoked on ConfigOpts
object

Fixes LP# 1196601

Change-Id: I2c3b412c5aa9adef87a92103b9749cc66158a3e4

commit_message:
Replace foo.next() with next(foo)

This patch uses the newer syntax for stepping over an iterable,
with an eye toward Python 3 compatability.

Change-Id: I9763596c0230f807557d0f2bf33d00124937b17c

'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-06-20 21:25:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I got the impression from discussion on -dev that alembic was the preferred migration method for new projects.  If that's the case, do we want to be moving this stuff to oslo?"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-21 12:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Ben Nemec


Yes we hava to move these utils to oslo. 

1) Not all code of these utils is connected with sqlalchemy-migrate. 
2) This utils will be used in old projects such as (glance and cinder) to provide unique constraints. 
3) This utils could help us to add all mising Unique Constraints in all DB backends in all old projects.
4) This utils will be used to create shadow tables
5) And these  utils have special methods to work with shadow tables: create, and check that this table is synced. 

So at this moment this is very important code for at least cinder and glance and nova. 

After we fix all states in all these projects + unify it all. 
We will be able to move to alembic, and remove part of unnecessary utils (but not all of these utils)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-21 19:26:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

There seem to be several different sets of related functionality in this patch. I think there should be a few different files, rather than lumping them all together. The functions for working with shadow tables could go in one place, the functions for cleaning up old data in a second, and the ones for dealing with the deleted column type could go in a third.

We discussed leaving out the SQLAlchemy "fixes" in another changeset, and I see some here, too. Are these also only needed for migration testing?'}, {'account_id': 7491, 'date': '2013-06-26 14:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7491, 'date': '2013-06-26 14:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (9 inline comments)

commit_message:
Migrate sqlalchemy utils from Nova

These utils are useful for database schema migrations
and can be reused in other projects.

Blueprint: oslo-sqlalchemy-utils

Change-Id: Ie54fcd5d75de05b48cca8b86c19325d7327f39cd

commit_message:
Add lower bound for all dependencies with upper bound

If we care about a max version of a package, also
specify the min version to have a range to check for.
Specify min version always in a '>=' fashion.
This simplifies a bit of the handling, as the first
given range is always the lower bound.

Also raise websockify to 0.5.1 in preparation of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35365/

Change-Id: Ia2672d675446f2ce9932c0c8b09e7b3c2c9cc392

commit_message:
Add bios for security guide authors.

Remove the light hearted nicknames for each author and replace with
bios.  Leaves the book with a more polished and professional feel.

Change-Id: Ica885881460da8eea1b507617d0201085ca8b931

commit_message:
uncap python-keystoneclient version requirement

if any of the projects specify a capped client, it has the
potential for preventing that client from being tested in the
gate. To fix this we have to uncap maximum versions of all
openstack client code in all openstack projects.

Fixes bug #1200214

Change-Id: I664d2f030972a3bbb08ae1c4b1710816b54b44b2

* Use local_settings.py.sample from Grizzly
* Make sure latest template includes Puppet settings
* Use @ notation for ERB template variables
  Fix Puppet 3.2 deprecation warnings (see Puppet bug #19058)
* Add ability to disable memcached by setting
  the 'cache_server_ip' parameter to False. It will fallback
  to using local-memory caching.
* Deprecate swift and quantum parameters. They have no effect.
* Fix deprecated settings:
    * CACHE_BACKEND (replaced by CACHES in Grizzly)
* Remove unused settings:
    * PROD (removed in Folsom)
    * USE_SSL (removed in Folsom)
    * SWIFT_ENABLED (removed in Essex)
    * QUANTUM_ENABLED (removed in Essex)

commit_message:
Update local_settings.py to latest version

* Use local_settings.py.sample from Grizzly
* Make sure latest template includes Puppet settings
* Use @ notation for ERB template variables
  Fix Puppet 3.2 deprecation warnings (see Puppet #19058)
* Add ability to disable memcached by setting
  the 'cache_server_ip' parameter to False. It will fallback
  to using local-memory caching.
* Deprecate swift and quantum parameters. They have no effect.
* Fix deprecated settings:
    * CACHE_BACKEND (replaced by CACHES in Grizzly)
* Remove unused settings:
    * PROD (removed in Folsom)
    * USE_SSL (removed in Folsom)
    * SWIFT_ENABLED (removed in Essex)
    * QUANTUM_ENABLED (removed in Essex)

Change-Id: I825a2fa73c941c4e244bc03f7d0477fff5816ea0

'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-06-24 19:51:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I like this overall. Eventually we'll probably want to move this decision into quantum/neutron. In the meantime, we might want to consider creating a default set of networks, possibly as a config, that would allow more than just a single network as default. As an example, our general use case uses two networks by default. But we can always inject this information into the call somewhere else if necessary."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-06-24 20:21:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Yeah, my only general concern about this was that for a default devstack install there are two networks created, which means you'll always have to specify a network in order to boot an instance.  It's not the end of the world, but it would be nice to find a way around that to save some developer hassle.  Maybe this could be configurable so devstack could turn off the behavior?

Also, still a couple of typo nits inline.  I hate to be that guy, but they're in exception messages which means users could see them.  That's the only reason for my -1."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-06-24 23:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

In the default quantum devstack there is only one tenant network ("private") and a shared external network ("public"), so there is no need to specify a network ID by default.'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-06-24 23:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-25 00:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Hmm, I guess I was getting confused by some dev environments where I had created new networks.  Anyway, looks like my nits have been addressed so +1 from me.'}, {'account_id': 4727, 'date': '2013-07-03 18:38:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

What do you say about adding a 'default' property for a Network? If there are no default networks and there is more than one network the system will reject the request as proposed."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-08 16:11:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think allowing a user to define which of their networks should be treated as the default is a nice idea - but it would need to be a new API extension, and so it would only be selectively enabled (depending on that extension being enabled) - hence I'd see that as a follow on change rather than something to fix as part of this bug."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-10 00:29:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

pretty sure I like this ... leaving it at +1 for now to let others comment just in case I'm missing something"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-11 18:55:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Does this mean currently there is no way to boot a vm attached to no networks unless the tenant doesn't have any networks?"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-11 22:52:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Correct - at the moment if you have one or more networks and don't specify any networks to server create it will attach to all of them.

With this change it will only automatically attach if there is exactly one network."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-12 12:05:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Just to be clear, attaching to zero network isn't part of bug fix - you couldn't do that before and you still can't.

(There is a really hacky way to do it by passing a port id to Nova and telling it to create 2 servers - but I'm guessing that's not really what you're looking for)."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-14 15:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

[{'created': '2013-06-21 15:05:44.000000000', 'message': "Don't attach to multiple Quantum networks by default

If no networking information is passed to a create request
Nova will connect the instance to all available networks.

In a Quantum configuration, where the user may have many
networks it really doesn't make sense to allow this, as the
network order is critical to most Guests and this approach
non-deterministic.

For example most guest OS's will only automatically configure
the first network which may not be externally route-able thereby
leaving the instance in an un-usable state.

To prevent the user getting into this state, the system should
reject requests with no networking information when more than
one quantum network is available, so that the user is made to
specify them in the required order.

Fixes bug 1193376

commit_message:
Don't attach to multiple Quantum networks by default

If no networking information is passed to a create request
Nova will connect the instance to all available networks.

In a Quantum configuration, where the user may have many
networks it really doesn't make sense to allow this, as the
network order is critical to most Guests and this approach
non-deterministic.

For example most guest OS's will only automatically configure
the first network which may not be externally route-able thereby
leaving the instance in an un-usable state.

To prevent the user getting into this state, the system should
reject requests with no networking information when more than
one quantum network is available, so that the user is made to
specify them in the required order.

Fixes bug 1193376

Change-Id: I950798cc3d04994b82be16e94397c117aaceecce

[{'created': '2013-07-06 08:34:25.000000000', 'message': 'Ec2Signer : Modify v4 signer to match latest boto

Previously the port component of the host:port header was stripped
to match what boto (2.6.0->2.9.2) did, however it seems that was a
n error in boto as from boto commit cfaba39 (in 2.9.3) the port is
now appended.

This means that when this fix is used with keystone, APIs which use
keystone to validate ec2 style v4 signatures (e.g the heat cfn API)
will require python-boto >= 2.9.3

Fixes bug #1197553

Change-Id: I4c01e7aef7015a79e6e6263492c51caf3a08e9e4
'}]
commit_message:
Ec2Signer : Modify v4 signer to match latest boto

Previously the port component of the host:port header was stripped
to match what boto (2.6.0->2.9.2) did, however it seems that was a
n error in boto as from boto commit cfaba39 (in 2.9.3) the port is
now appended.

This means that when this fix is used with keystone, APIs which use
keystone to validate ec2 style v4 signatures (e.g the heat cfn API)
will require python-boto >= 2.9.3

Fixes bug #1197553

Change-Id: I4c01e7aef7015a79e6e6263492c51caf3a08e9e4

Finally, please go trough your paste submissions and click the Abandon button where needed; try to scope your changes, split those into a few code reviews and later push updates (new patch sets) against the existing reviews until your work is merged."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-15 15:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add support for the extra route extension in the NVP plugin.

The underlying feature is available in NVP 3.2, which introduces a
new type of router. Therefore, create_lrouter needs to be made
version 'aware'.

This led to a number of fixes in the nvplib, especially around how
version is retrieved and how version-dependent methods are called.

Implements blueprint nvp-extra-route-extension

Change-Id: Ie4e2d93f70e1948a62563c8523aea61bb2194c84

commit_message:
remove python-glanceclient cap

if any of the projects specify a capped client, it has the
potential for preventing that client from being tested in the
gate. To fix this we have to uncap maximum versions of all
openstack client code in all openstack projects.

(Note Neutronclient needs special dispensation for now, so
it is left capped.)

(Rebased after a neutron rename landed)

Fixes bug #1200214

Change-Id: I0168cb645279a819942a442c800afb1d0336203c

commit_message:
CLI for disable service reason

Adds cli option to allow users to give reason
for service-disable. Also adds disabled reason
as a column in service list, so any disabled service
can be seen with reason.

A recent nova change that allows disable-log-reason
allows users to provide reason for disabling service.
This just adds the cli option for the method.

Blueprint record-reason-for-disabling-service

Change-Id: If263788c34279d6b4c568d5e0320448d2ff67a12

subject: Add Support for OpenStack Networking VPNaaS (IPSec)
messages:
[{'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-06-07 17:41:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

WIP : Quantum side is not merged yet.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-06-07 18:11:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Nachi, is the VPNaaS layered on top of Quantum or does it require config changes that can not be done after it starts?  If is just layered I probably prefer it to not be directly in DevStack.  We've already held back on adding other XaaS projects, and this may apply to LBaaS too.  I could be convinced that it needs to be here, I just don't know enough about it and am trying to keep devstack from expanding without bound unnecessarily.

This is why we added extras.d and the ability to drop install/uninstall scripts in there to handle layered stuff."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-07 18:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Hi Dean

Could you share how to write setup code for XaaS?
(extra.d)
# It is very helpful if we can wiki page for that purpose."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-06-18 15:34:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Nachi, we ship a extras.d/README with a short description and extras.d/80-tempest.sh as an example.  They really are that simple.  One item that is missing from README is that those scripts are sourced by stack.sh (and unstack.sh) so all config/environment variables are available.

I've got a note to add this to devsyack.org."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-06-18 20:13:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Dean

Thanks. I checked the code of extra.d.
But it looks like it can't support quantum services because 

1) We need to change configuration of quantum from service
2) VPN needs to change binary of l3-agent

May be, we need more extra hooks from stack.sh or lib/quantum
How do you think?"}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-06-21 16:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-06-21 17:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

'}, {'account_id': 6460, 'date': '2013-07-08 19:50:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Very cool.  Great to see this excellent piece of extensibility added. I just had one inline comment to improve the ability for folks with limited  familiarity to the keystone code base to have an easier time creating a plugin."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-07-08 20:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

Brad, the beauty of plugins is that the code can live anywhere, so as long as you have the class correctly specified in keystone.conf. Token provider plugins are no different from the existing backend drivers or authentication plugins. The interface is documented in keystone/token/provider.py. Keystone documentation, or OpenStack documentation in that matter, are pretty much all in the code. :) I've learned this from day one, or maybe day seventh, when I jumped onto the OpenStack bandwagon is to get good at reading the code. The phrase "the truth is in the code" is never more apparent in OpenStack. :)

The second example, I am hoping, will be that of binding token.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35093/

The third example, I am also hoping, will be that of a federated token provider. I would even venture a guess that when the dust settles, oauth will have its own provider.

If you want to play around with the default keystone token provider, there are a few things you can try out quickly.

1) extend the default Provider class to issue short-lived tokens for (say) users in the experimental domain
2) extend the default Provider to generate tokens with a custom token ID.
3) if the given user is a member of the Admin group, append the extra DomainAdmin role to their scoped token.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-07-08 21:02:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(10 inline comments)

i'm totally lost on token_api vs token_provider_api at this point. they have the same method names."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-07-09 00:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: (10 inline comments)

I was thinking that a very simple token provider that just did basic uuid tokens with in-memory storage (a big dictionary) to clearly illustrate what methods need to be implemented with lots of annotation. Might be best for someone other than gyee to try and write this. What if we just open up this requirement as a bug and I'll take ownership of writing this sample?"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-07-09 14:10:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Do not merge

(2 inline comments)

Why is there not a 'PKI' token provider and a 'UUID' token provider? That was the entire point of making things pluggable."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-07-09 16:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

So I originally had two different providers UUID and PKI. Adam put up an argument that they are really two different mechanisms of a same provider because the only thing different about them is the token ID. The vision for a pluggable token provider is really to facilitate functionality such as binded tokens, federation, etc.

I can bring back two different providers if that's what it takes."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-09 17:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

We need both active at the same time.

Both UUID and PKI tokens are misnamed, and I apologize for that.   

UUID token are tokens referenced by their primary id in the database. PKI tokens are crypto signed documents that are passed around.  The primary key for PKI tokens is the md5 hash of the document. A user can hash a PKI token and pass it to the same API as the UUID token in order to fetch it out of the database.

So, while a server needs to decide whether to server UUID or PKI tokens, it has to be able to respond to either for validate.'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-10 07:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

recheck bug 1194026'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 07:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 17:27:30.000000000', 'message': "Pluggable Token Provider (Part 1)

Abstract token provider backend to make token provider pluggable. It enables
deployers to customize token management to add their own capabilities.
Token provider is responsible for issuing, checking, validating, and
revoking tokens. Note the distinction between token 'driver' and 'provider'.
Token 'driver' simply provides token CRUD. It does not issue or interpret
tokens.

Token provider is specified by the 'provider' property in the '[token]'
section of the Keystone configuration file.

Note: This is one of the redos of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29021
as it was too big and we need to submit the review in smaller chunks.

Partially implemented blueprint pluggable-token-format. V2 token provider implementation will be in part 2.

This patch also fixes bug 1186061.

Change-Id: I755fb850765ea99e5237626a2e645e6ceb42a9d3

revoking tokens. Note the distinction between token 'driver' and 'provider'.

commit_message:
Implements Pluggable V3 Token Provider

Abstract V3 token provider backend to make token provider pluggable. It enables
deployers to customize token management to add their own capabilities.
Token provider is responsible for issuing, checking, validating, and
revoking tokens. Note the distinction between token 'driver' and 'provider'.
Token 'driver' simply provides token persistence. It does not issue or
interpret tokens.

Token provider is specified by the 'provider' property in the '[token]'
section of the Keystone configuration file.

Partially implemented blueprint pluggable-token-format.

This patch also fixes bug 1186061.

Change-Id: I755fb850765ea99e5237626a2e645e6ceb42a9d3

commit_message:
Unset OS_xx variable before generate configuration

When generate_sample.sh generate the configuration of the
keystone middleware part, it use OS_XXXXX environment variable
if this one is set instead of the default one.

This change unset this vairables, before generate_sample.sh
inspect the code to always have the default value.

Change-Id: I365387e99dff0e1c64cd1c4198088200bf726cd7

(1 inline comment)

Makes sense to me - in your previous patch, you made get_instance_bdms() return the legacy format and updated all the callers in nova.compute.api but forgot about callers in nova.api

To fix it in the safest way, you've made get_instance_bdms() return the legacy format by default and reverted the changes to the callers in nova.compute.api

Obviously, you intend to convert all callers to use the new format in time ... this is just an incremental step"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-13 07:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Add legacy flag to get_instance_bdms

In change If30afdb59d4c4268b97d3d10270df2cc729a0c4c for flexibility
reasons, it was decided to not change the method API.get_instance_bdms
to return legacy format but to change all the places it was called.
Sadly few of them were missed.

This patch adds a legacy flag so that all use-cases still do what is
expected unless explicitly changed to do otherwise.

fixes bug: 1191913
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: Iaebbb851e4a2a9cbee13fa271bf15d789db23f24

commit_message:
Wildcards in User Host

This bug-fix, allows wildcards to be used for user host via
providing ability to use '%' and '_'.

Change-Id: Iebec499368b83f285283a0a8a80a2a63f0831dea
Fixes: bug #1199197

commit_message:
Fix route for bulk-get message by ID

This patch includes the following changes:

* /v1/queues/my-queue?ids=1,2,3 => /v1/queues/my-queue/messages?id=1,2,3
* Update Location header to suite
* Always return the same schema for location header, regardless of the
  number of messages POSTed.

Change-Id: I4559222e8f4685af1020c2743c26de699aef30dd
Fixes: bug #1194571
Fixes: bug #1165102

Use exceptions from oslo

These exceptions can be used in novaclient, keystoneclient,
glanceclient, and other client projects.

Partially implements: blueprint common-client-library

Change-Id: I43918316622b1c1d722872fe30199db6a3a7bb76

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 15:11:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add variable to specify additional parameters for the Neutron service.

This patch adds a new variable, Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS, which can
override any parameter of the [DEFAULT] section of the neutron.conf
file. It can be used for example to define the number of DHCP agents
that should host a network:
  Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS=(dhcp_agents_per_network=2)

Change-Id: Ic34164457e64dec6ca8ec76be1772f998d100991
'}]
commit_message:
Add variable to specify additional parameters for the Neutron service.

This patch adds a new variable, Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS, which can
override any parameter of the [DEFAULT] section of the neutron.conf
file. It can be used for example to define the number of DHCP agents
that should host a network:
  Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS=(dhcp_agents_per_network=2)

Change-Id: Ic34164457e64dec6ca8ec76be1772f998d100991

commit_message:
xenapi: preinstall python netaddr

On our CI system, the devstack instance was reporting errors, that are
related to devstack's address_in_net function - that requires the python
netaddr library to be installed. This patch preinstalls this python
package.

Fixes bug 1097667

Change-Id: I8af199427f06cfdf0a68d96d87fe3e541199dca7

commit_message:
Require later version of stevedore

Changes requirement for stevedore to be >=0.10 because
that version of stevedore has the ability to propagate
exceptions up through the map call which is required for
some of the Nova V3 API extensions to work properly

Change-Id: Ic2316e1f0cba28521950f3313652514dd7484378

[{'created': '2013-06-27 02:39:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add HTTPretty to test requirements.

HTTPretty is a means of stubbing HTTP calls that is library independent.
It is MIT licensed and can be found: https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty
for examples of its use. Development is active with the 0.6.2 version
released only a week ago.

I think an approach like this is simpler than the current means of
stubbing requests or HTTPlib, more explicit in what sites requests are
being made to and it will allow a common test layout/format between
httplib, requests or whatever other http library is being used.

Change-Id: I01f291d324fd9902a4e728775019fe3c43bcf61e

commit_message:
Add HTTPretty to test requirements.

HTTPretty is a means of stubbing HTTP calls that is library independent.
It is MIT licensed and can be found: https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty
for examples of its use. Development is active with the 0.6.2 version
released only a week ago.

I think an approach like this is simpler than the current means of
stubbing requests or HTTPlib, more explicit in what sites requests are
being made to and it will allow a common test layout/format between
httplib, requests or whatever other http library is being used.

Change-Id: I01f291d324fd9902a4e728775019fe3c43bcf61e

commit_message:
Changes select_destinations to return dicts instead of objects

This patch refactors the select_destinations to return a dict
instead of a HostState object. As the result of this change, no
additional code needs to be added to jsonutils.to_primitive
function.

Partially implements bp cold-migrations-to-conductor

Change-Id: Ic24080766e48abff36bbbe2c04fa5da77621fde5

The usage message for glance-cache-manage lists "clean" as an available
command, but this functionality is part of a separate tool,
glance-cache-cleaner.

Remove any references to this to avoid confusion.

DocImpact
Fixes bug 1189451

Change-Id: I2aba8164ab9ef0c3bef31870cb3771233a722d27
'}]
commit_message:
Remove references to clean arg from cache-manage

The usage message for glance-cache-manage lists "clean" as an available
command, but this functionality is part of a separate tool,
glance-cache-cleaner.

Remove any references to this to avoid confusion.

DocImpact
Fixes bug 1189451

Change-Id: I2aba8164ab9ef0c3bef31870cb3771233a722d27

commit_message:
In the volume actions test the xml api were not supported,only json request response was supported. for all tests there is  json and xml request/response.For this test (test_volumes_actions.py) only json was working.I add the xml interface

subject: remove indentation
messages:
[{'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-13 12:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow#Updating_a_Change

Normally, you update your previous change locally and _replace_ the previously submitted one with the new one.

The review.openstack.org will remember to the previous change, with a different Change Set number. (Starts from 1)

The final tempest git repo will only contains the final approved change, with the last (git) commit message.

So, in the commit message you do not need to say anything about the previously --amend change. You can add a comment here, if the changes between the two change sets are no obvious.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-13 12:58:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

- http://logs.openstack.org/36974/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/31636 : SUCCESS in 56m 12s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36974/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/3376 : SUCCESS in 17m 15s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36974/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron-full/132 : FAILURE in 53m 19s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-14 11:55:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Can you abandon several changes which accidentally submitted as very small independent change ?

IMHO you should try to keep only one and submit it as one change. Usually if something logically one change, (foo type of tests + services/rest_clients for foo type of resources)  can be single patch.

Usually we do not add services/rest_clients alone,
They should be added with a test case which actually using it.

Less than 200 line change usually not an issue an review.
Mixing different type/category  of change in single commit, can be an issue.
Type of change:
- bug fix
- adding a new test/services
- re-factoring something
- style change
- adding new tool

They shouldn't be mixed, but exceptions exists, especially if just small part belongs to an another category."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-14 11:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The git interactive rebase  or the squash merge can be helpful.

Several people recommends this plugin, for splitting joining patches.
https://github.com/tpope/vim-fugitive'}, {'account_id': 8085, 'date': '2013-07-14 12:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Hii Afazekas ,

please review it here-

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36977/'}, {'account_id': 8085, 'date': '2013-07-15 16:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/36982/1/check/gate-tempest-pep8/4137 : FAILURE in 1m 33s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36982/1/check/gate-tempest-docs/686 : SUCCESS in 1m 30s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36982/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/31958 : SUCCESS in 43m 22s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36982/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cells-full/124 : FAILURE in 15m 15s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36982/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/31650 : SUCCESS in 44m 05s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36982/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/3395 : SUCCESS in 17m 12s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36982/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron-full/137 : FAILURE in 53m 13s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-14 18:16:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Please, Fix the white-space issue in the previews change.

AFAIK every change submitted to any OpenStack review, MUST transfer the state from a working one to working one.

If 'Jenkins' constantly votes '-1' the system prevents the merge.

Non of the dependent changes can be rejected by 'jenkins'.

Please squash your patch to a bigger one. (smaller than 500 line).
(The too big patches (200 line +)are not good because difficult to review.)"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-14 18:41:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

https://help.github.com/articles/interactive-rebase

create backup from your git repo (just to be sure nothing lost)
cp -a home/tempest home/tempest-backup

git rebase -i master

In the interactive response you need to change the pick to s (squash). (probably excluding the first one)


If on review you get -1 vote, and you need to update your change. You can use the 'git commit -a --amend' to overwrite your  previous change. After that you can do 'git review'.

The change id 'Change-Id: I970e89c2ed5b7b278d7eb03807a678df4d66a665'  implicitly added if you configured the review (git review -s). The review system (gerrit), considers the change as modified change when it submitted with the same Change-Id, without creating a new review, in the review.openstack.org.

Now, you created a lot of small probably not merge-able change. It makes the change list too big. Can you abandon some of them ?
You just need to click to the 'Abandon Change'."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-14 18:48:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I forget to mention, The 'git review -d <change-id>' can help you to download a change from gerrit.

See the $ git help review"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-14 19:07:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You can join to #openstack-qa freenode IRC channel, if you have any question.

On Web it is accessible via the  http://webchat.freenode.net.

Or, you can use your favorite IRC client Xchat/pidgin/.. and pick one server from this list http://freenode.net/irc_servers.shtml.

/join #openstack-qa

commit_message:
Improve openstack-clients element.

Add keystone to the list of installed clients. Expanding this element
allows other elements, such as nagios to consistently install the
openstack clients with out having to duplicate code or depend on the
entire services element, in this case, Keystone to get the client.

Change-Id: I71e82dbf5e7d95a063ac8755c2cfc93a18ab6fb9
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update Fedora cloud image to its latest version

Latest Fedora cloud images are available here

  http://cloud.fedoraproject.org/

With this change, when a Fedora version comes up,
d-i-b will point to it automatically.

Fixes 1199237

(Also, thanks to Lucas Gomes for testing.)

Change-Id: Ifcb8a48f3baf3ef841f00e6a20c6fd9f79fea129

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-15 15:31:53.000000000', 'message': "EFI hosts

If you have an EFI host but the image doesn't have the EFI modules
installed the grub-install command will fail in case the --target
argument is not set. The problem is that the grub-install script will
check whether the /sys/firmware/efi file exists or not to determine if
it's an EFI installation, but this value comes from the host, so this
patch will look for the /sys/firmware/efi file and will also check if
the EFI modules are installed in the image, if not set the --target to
a non-efi platform.

Change-Id: I4481b43e4a8fe4144be9c7eb9d9c618bbb2df21e
"}, {'created': '2013-07-15 15:31:53.000000000', 'message': "EFI hosts

If you have an EFI host but the image doesn't have the EFI modules
installed the grub-install command will fail in case the --target
argument is not set. The problem is that the grub-install script will
check whether the /sys/firmware/efi file exists or not to determine if
it's an EFI installation, but this value comes from the host, so this
patch will look for the /sys/firmware/efi file and will also check if
the EFI modules are installed in the image, if not set the --target to
a non-efi platform.

Change-Id: I4481b43e4a8fe4144be9c7eb9d9c618bbb2df21e
"}]
commit_message:
EFI hosts

If you have an EFI host but the image doesn't have the EFI modules
installed the grub-install command will fail in case the --target
argument is not set. The problem is that the grub-install script will
check whether the /sys/firmware/efi file exists or not to determine if
it's an EFI installation, but this value comes from the host, so this
patch will look for the /sys/firmware/efi file and will also check if
the EFI modules are installed in the image, if not set the --target to
a non-efi platform.

Change-Id: I4481b43e4a8fe4144be9c7eb9d9c618bbb2df21e

faulty driver.

Fixes: Bug #1200664

commit_message:
replace left quantum string for enable_lb

writing the correct config for horizon to show LBaaS entry properly
like:

OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK = {
    'enable_lb': True
}

Change-Id: I7f522a150a3732ee734f2b818910ff92c8c73028
Fixes: bug #1200098

commit_message:
Port user_data API to v3 Part 2

Ports the user_data extensions and the corresponding unittests
to the v3 framework. Moves the commented out tests from the v3
version of test_servers to the user data extension unittests.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Id9b406271d821a99bbe7a3b3eb6ad7fc549ae7a3

commit_message:
Use a real MongoDB instance to run unit tests

This will allow more real tests, and use of more functionnality not
implemented in MIM such as aggregation.

Change-Id: Ie38deadf190db33863c99d4610157349484ac10f

commit_message:
xenapi: xe network-attach for OVS bridge creation

For Neutron we need an additional OVS bridge to be present. The xe
network-create command did not create the bridge immediately. A
workaround was applied to attach a network interface to that network,
forcing xapi to create the underlying OVS bridge. It turned out, that
the xe network-attach command could be used instead, so the workaround
is removed and replaced with the proper solution by this patch.

Fixes bug 1197305

Change-Id: I10cc763531b71238f0bc12a12de985f8f35d7e27

subject: clean logical volumes in init_cinder
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-08 15:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36096/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/29303 : SUCCESS in 42m 32s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36096/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/29009 : SUCCESS in 42m 51s

- http://logs.openstack.org/36096/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/15543 : FAILURE in 12m 09s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-08 19:05:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I think this is ok, though it's hard for me to see if the cleanup is exactly the same as this call being removed. I know that cinder over quota issues tends to be the most broken part of long running devstack installs."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-08 19:40:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

DevStack performs some 'safety' cleans on startup to eliminate problems from subsequent runs of stack.sh without an intervening unstack.sh, clean.sh or reboot.  We do this with system-level services: kvm instances, iscsi volumes, databases.  cleanup_cinder() is not called here as it does more than we need.  That is part of the reason _cleanup_lvm() (formerly _clean_volume_group()) was factored out.  Renaming the two _clean_volume_group() calls is the only work I see here."}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I had to split the function cleanup_lvm because it was doing more thing than what the previous function _clean_volume_group was doing.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-09 13:24:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

cleanup_cinder() should be the only place where clean up is done.
This function should be reliable so that any subsequent run of devstack
should succeed. Moreover _clean_volume_group() doesn't exist anymore.

Change-Id: I96fe749013b5cf1fd3411b2ba661302873e92994

commit_message:
clean logical volumes in init_cinder

This part of code was forgotten when _clean_volume_group()
has been renamed.

Change-Id: I96fe749013b5cf1fd3411b2ba661302873e92994

commit_message:
Add integration bridge to the nova.conf

This is needed when running the compute service with
vSphere as virt backend, and Neutron as networking
solution.

Fixes bug #1200677

Change-Id: Iff01559be437d1409c13224574458d23a1edd1a4

devstack neutron lib needs to find some functions named
'neutron_plugin_configure_XXXXXX' in the neutron plugin lib
Part of them are usually in the plugin agent file.

commit_message:
Source linuxbridge_agent in linuxbridge plugin

devstack neutron lib needs to find some functions named
'neutron_plugin_configure_XXXXXX' in the neutron plugin lib
Part of them are usually in the plugin agent file.

For linuxbridge plugin some of theses functions are missing.
This change load the linuxbridge_agent file in linuxbridge file to make
missing functions available to neutron lib when linux bridge plugin is used.

Fix bug #1195237

Change-Id: I567bedc84e77c041e9418773fba1f74b33bcf604

commit_message:
xenapi: Exit immediately if zipball download fails

If install_os_domU.sh fails to download the Xapi plugins zipball
correctly it ignores the error and continues the installation.
This could damage the hypervisor's filesystem, as it may delete
files or overwrite them with garbage.

Change-Id: I9f6dc31b977592e2818e37b2d310c2a5dc477364
Fixes: bug #1195640

[{'created': '2013-07-15 12:36:36.000000000', 'message': 'Select keystone endpoint url bases on SSL setting

When keystone is ssl enabled, (by setting ssl/enabled = TRUE in
keystone.conf) the keystone auth server is using HTTPS instead of HTTP
as the protocol. This patch generates the correct endpoint for the
keystone service calls.

Change-Id: I7514916111911bd13b4765a81bfd1e7b1810a638
'}]
commit_message:
Select keystone endpoint url bases on SSL setting

When keystone is ssl enabled, (by setting ssl/enabled = TRUE in
keystone.conf) the keystone auth server is using HTTPS instead of HTTP
as the protocol. This patch generates the correct endpoint for the
keystone service calls.

Change-Id: I7514916111911bd13b4765a81bfd1e7b1810a638

commit_message:
Add authenticate method to oauth code

Forgot to add one last method when I initially checked in
the first set of code; the authenticate method will return an
actual keystone token that the user may now use.

Also, I added some changes to other methods because the client
has been updated.

Change-Id: Ie2707689e0df1fb1bc92177f932baf23fe1ca920

commit_message:
Align OpenStack client versions with project requirements.

This brings heat into line with the consensus on how to specify
version range caps.

Fixes bug: #1200214

Change-Id: I14affc96c44f865fdd0516c1eb4eb59f1a808b82

subject: Add resource_data table for free-form key/value data.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2013-07-08 20:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7395, 'date': '2013-07-08 20:21:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7395, 'date': '2013-07-08 20:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-08 21:10:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Thanks for tackling this. At a previous Heat meeting a consensus emerged that a separate resource_data table which stores key/value pairs would be better than a single column.

This would reduce the risk of concurrent updates causing problems once resource_data is used in a wider variety of use-cases (for example, implementing blueprint tags-support).

See Nova InstanceMetadata for something like what I was thinking of.

Columns could be something like:
- id
- key
- value (feel free to make this bigger than 255 chars, and it could still contain json)
- resource_id
- redact (boolean flag which indicates that the value is a secret which should normally be hidden when all resource_data is displayed to the user)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-08 21:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36123/2/check/gate-heat-pep8/4061 : SUCCESS in 2m 25s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36123/2/check/gate-heat-python26/4014 : SUCCESS in 5m 08s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36123/2/check/gate-heat-python27/4015 : SUCCESS in 2m 34s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36123/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/29393 : SUCCESS in 46m 53s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36123/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/29099 : SUCCESS in 56m 14s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36123/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/496 : SUCCESS in 18m 19s
'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-08 21:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Search for "abused" for the meeting discussion
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/heat/2013/heat.2013-06-19-20.00.log.html'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-08 22:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Maybe "sanitize" is a better column name than "redact", see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/31738/6'}, {'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2013-07-09 16:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Steve,

Here's the blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/resource-data

I think it wasn't showing up in the search because I had marked it "implemented".

I'll go ahead and move this into its own table.

commit_message:
Add resource_data table for free-form key/value data.

This can be used to store arbitrary resource-specific data, such as
SSH keys.

Blueprint resource-data.

Change-Id: Ic148bd131f528a676904c8f37fd6deb936917152

commit_message:
Port instance_actions API to v3 Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the agent
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ibf0784a455942185799d40395fab5e8eb112e2d8

commit_message:
port instance_actions API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I7e59afc952f668c0d8933463c5d4a5843d36802f

Deployment logs fetching

Added Deployment instance to group, store and fetch deployment logs (status event) by the deployment attempts

Change-Id: I5d31da1140c3fcf9b72322093a5569ce54b36aaf

'}, {'created': '2013-07-09 03:13:18.000000000', 'message': 'Port AvailabilityZone API to v3 Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the AvailabilityZone
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework. Moves the
commented out tests from the v3 version of test_servers to the config

commit_message:
Port AvailabilityZone API to v3 Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the AvailabilityZone
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework. Moves the
commented out tests from the v3 version of test_servers to the config
drive extension unittests.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I2cf214061e3accbb056ca53c224df1c5bf74a6e4

subject: port AvailabilityZone API into v3 part1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-13 08:34:28.000000000', 'message': 'port AvailabilityZone API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I88f81d76a8dd0559e5a64a3c9d8aa93c6d2fa107

commit_message:
port AvailabilityZone API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I88f81d76a8dd0559e5a64a3c9d8aa93c6d2fa107

commit_message:
Port admin-actions API into v3 part2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the admin-actions
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ib109f52999de8e986c258d8d9d35d8193e8b0851

commit_message:
Provide CPU number as additional metadata.

So that a tranformer can access the CPU number in order to
calculate CPU utilization %, we now include this in the
resource metadata of samples for the cpu meter.

Change-Id: I6eb8c65bf4ddf4dd3447e5e32c79d92a3d38f5f1

subject: Add generic block device driver

'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-04-17 17:17:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you please create a blueprint and link it from the commit message so that we can have some background on this?'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-04-20 16:35:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Ann,

This is awesome and very much needed/requested as of late.

One thing to think about, we're working on this idea of some common block-storage functionality pushed up in to OSLO, I see a lot of your implementation fitting perfectly in that model.  We can either pull implementation out later and reduce the driver to use that, or work on sorting out the separation now."}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2013-04-22 12:44:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, John!

Thank you for your comment. I am glad to hear that this task has so much demand. I am working on iSCSI support for this driver now, so it will be ready for merge soon.

I am interested what will such functionality be for in OSLO project. Where will it be needed besides cinder? In my opinion, at first this driver should start working in cinder and then common parts can be extracted into OSLO.'}, {'account_id': 6043, 'date': '2013-04-24 18:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

(2 inline comments)

Hi Ann,

First off, thanks for taking this on.  There are a number of holes and a couple things that I'm concerned about (regarding safety checks around creating/deleting).

Some things I'm fine with filling in as we go, and TBH I don't want to get too carried away as I'm working on a set of utilities that eventually should be used by this driver.

There are some questions around "why not just use LVM" but I think if we can provide a safe and complete driver we should  see what folks decide to use.'}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-05-22 08:37:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Hi John,

I can answer to the question about LVM. We have several concerns related to the Savanna (https://launchpad.net/savanna) project - LVM generally reduces performance of the Hadoop (or any other I/O intensive app) so it'll be better to directly attach disks using VirtIO w/o iSCSI and LVM."}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2013-05-22 14:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add generic block device driver

This driver adds an ability to create volumes on any block device on
local host.

This driver supports the following features:

- Volume Create/Delete
- Volume Attach/Detach
- Get Volume Stats
- Copy Image to Volume
- Copy Volume to Image
- Clone Volume

Not implemented:

- Snapshot Create/Delete
- Create Volume from Snapshot

These features are not implemented because there is no generic way
to create snapshots for block devices.

bp block-device-driver

Change-Id: If5fcaf2775daf660c46d630eea0f9633ca816ee9

commit_message:
Port service API to v3 Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the service
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework

This also fix the xml/json inconsistance issue in update:
1:add root element 'service' for json format.
2:merge the extended_service.
3:raise HTTPBadRequest instead of HTTPUnprocessableEntity

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning
Partially implements: bp v3-api-inconsistencies

Change-Id: I88cfbe69e0bc0351e81a831345f2a36bf63f5f4f

Let's keep these changes confined to string formatting"}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-13 06:12:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Mark, thanks for review.
Sorry for repeating 'please review comments'.
In fact I was adding reviewers and posting comments to get them notified.

Regarding your comments: the bug in general is about removing locals(), not not only about string formatting.
In particular, using locals for injection could lead to unexpected exceptions if mandatory contain names of other local variables.
However your comment showed me that this particular usage fix could be improved."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-13 07:21:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-13 07:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I really don't see the value in this change anyways. Honestly really dislike the whole console-script thing."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-07-15 09:46:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

well, I'm not going to argue about this one ;-)"}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 09:26:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a bug when unused directories are created.

We found that in some tests created libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver
object and called method spawn(). This method call self._create_image()
fuction and fileutils.ensure_tree() function inside it create a new directiory.
So we added new stubs to ensure_tree() function.

Fixes bug 1194542

Change-Id: I95aa955f895781704807c38f90ff888862dcc3c2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a bug when unused directories are created.

We found that in some tests created libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver
object and called method spawn(). This method call self._create_image()
fuction and fileutils.ensure_tree() function inside it create a new directiory.
So we added new stubs to ensure_tree() function.

Fixes bug 1194542

Change-Id: I95aa955f895781704807c38f90ff888862dcc3c2

[{'created': '2013-07-12 09:45:00.000000000', 'message': 'Remove inappropriate assert() usage

Asserts should really only be used in tests. However, if there is a place in the
code where you know a given state should not be possible but perhaps could
happen (for example memory corruption) and you want to trap it in a known place
instead of letting it float through the system in less detectable places assert
can be used. It should be considered a debugging tool and not a way to validate
parameters.

There are few places in neutron where asserts are used in inappropriate manner.

Fix bug #1199354

Change-Id: I3d7b176a3aaf403e27e2c225da1bf1fd08e11b30

commit_message:
Remove inappropriate assert() usage

Asserts should really only be used in tests. However, if there is a place in the
code where you know a given state should not be possible but perhaps could
happen (for example memory corruption) and you want to trap it in a known place
instead of letting it float through the system in less detectable places assert
can be used. It should be considered a debugging tool and not a way to validate
parameters.

There are few places in neutron where asserts are used in inappropriate manner.

Fix bug #1199354

Change-Id: I3d7b176a3aaf403e27e2c225da1bf1fd08e11b30

commit_message:
Stop creating disk images during wipe-openstack.

Our principled separation of concern places one-time setup like flavor
creation and baremetal deploy ramdisk creation and registration
outside the boot-stack problem-space. The incubator devtest story now
does that, so doing it here is just redundant.

Change-Id: I63cf52b6dca48f8f75b550388c6912eda5c0f533

commit_message:
Stop passing no longer honoured keys in.

The undercloud (and boot-stack in general) no longer create baremetal
flavors or register baremetal ramdisks, so passing in keys for that
isn't needed.

Change-Id: I8c20e95f3a57418d7ae160a296a092cd71254e3d

I'm skeptical about this. You say in the bug that this only affects UEC images, yet that would be a bug with how the volume was created, not in how it was booted.

Much more detail is needed, IMHO.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-04 02:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/35460/4/check/gate-nova-pylint/15747 : SUCCESS in 10m 40s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-07-04 03:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Dan, it is correct that there is no error message when booting from volumes, but it does not mean the VM is running in a correct and healthy state.

This is an issue currently I found only happens to the UEC image. A UEC image consists of a triplet: a kernel, an init ramdisk and a root file system image, e.g. cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec, cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec-kernel and cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec-ramdisk. If we boot a VM from a UEC image(root file system image), we need to make sure that Nova can find the kernel_id and ramdisk_id.

Suppose three of them have already existed in glance. I create a volume from the root file system image(cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec), then only this image is copied to a volume. If I boot a VM from the volume via "nova boot --block-device-mapping vda=$vol_id"(no image_id specified), Nova will not know the kernel_id and ramdisk_id, so that the VM launched in this situation will have some issues, e.g. it can not be pinged(Again, no error in the log. The VM is supposed to boot with a specified kernel_id and ramdisk_id, and we have both of them in th volume data. However, the create_instance in nova code won't retrive it, because the code tries to look for them in volume/image "properties" , but they are saved in "volume_image_metadata".). That is why I convert the structure of volume data and make sure kernel_id and ramdisk_id can be accessed by checking "properties". After this, the VM booted will be accessed via ping.
I also discussed with cinder PTL, John Griffith. There is no need to change in Cinder by avoiding something confusing. 
In the end, I will forward you a mail thread for this topic.'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-07-07 13:56:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There is a patch that solves this in review, but got forgotten a little bit so Dan & Russell - please take a look there (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33296/8).

Vincent - also take a look at the discussion on the patch above and some points I bring up there. tl; dr - it needs to be taken into account in places other than boot in the VM lifecycle - but it's an issue we can work around later"}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-07-08 02:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks, Nokola.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-15 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Convert the data structure of the volume, when booting from volumes.

If no image-id is specified to boot from a volume, the data structure of the
volume should be converted into the image-like structure. Otherwise, information
like kernel_id and ramdisk_id will not be accessed in future code, though they
are both available in volume. The VM launched in this situation can not be
accessed via ping.

This patch resolves this issue by adding the conversion of the data structure.

Fixed Bug 1155512.

Change-Id: Ie1ccb27adda8d5b669db7ca4c56269575edf93e1

commit_message:
add force-delete and restore server admin action.

Nova has a DeferredDelete extension, which provides a safe strategy
when you try to delete servers. This patch add "force-delete" and
"restore" subcommand to novaclient.

Change-Id: Ib882dc86eb916af21c407e0b14b53b0e33011c8f
Implements: blueprint server-force-delete-and-restore

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 23:34:23.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent possible server list damage in BigSwitch plugin

The old failover logic for the BigSwitch plugin modified a
list of controllers as it tested them. If the code for one
thread unexpectedly raised an exception or died, the global
server list could lose a server permanently.
This patch addresses that by flagging servers as failed instead
so the global server list is never modified.

Fixes: #1200022
Change-Id: Id2dcb820ef9f62fd03e3215bff3345e56c78afe2

commit_message:
Prevent possible server list damage in BigSwitch plugin

The old failover logic for the BigSwitch plugin modified a
list of controllers as it tested them. If the code for one
thread unexpectedly raised an exception or died, the global
server list could lose a server permanently.
This patch addresses that by flagging servers as failed instead
so the global server list is never modified.

Fixes: bug #1200022
Change-Id: Id2dcb820ef9f62fd03e3215bff3345e56c78afe2

Remove recipe[openstack-identity::db] from the identity roles

Gary, the current code doesn't allow for more than one IP address for each tunnel endpoint, and I don't think this patch should change to allow that either. More thought would be needed into how to support multiple IP endpoints per host, per tunnel, even with a single tunnel_type."}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Mathieu: After spending the day trying to implement your suggestions, I kept getting closer and closer to your partial mesh change. I think what we need to do is get this small change in now to allow for the agent to support multiple tunnel_types in the config. Then we need to port your partial mesh change [1] over to ML2. Are you ok with this approach? I'll even volunteer to port your change over if you want.

Yong, please review my writeup on this document [1]. I will also post this on openstack-dev for others to comment on.

[1] https://docs.google.com/a/mestery.com/document/d/1NT3JVn2lNk_Hp7lP7spc3ysWgSyHa4V0pYELAiePD1s/edit?usp=sharing'}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

Yong, I opened this bug [1] to track deprecating 'enable_tunneling' support in the server and to properly add a 'tunnel_types' argument to the server as well. I'm thinking now I should just combine that work into this patch, because it would address all of your concerns by having the server pass the tunnel_type in the tunnel_sync RPC call. What are your thoughts on this?

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1196689"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(4 inline comments)

The code looks good to me - little nits inside.

However, I have a question which is a bit more forward looking.
With ML2, one would be enable to use the same plugin to define networks mapped to distinct transport types.
This would enable to have on the same host VMs on a GRE network and other VMs on a VxLAN network.
Is there therefore a requirement that tunnel_types should have the same value on all agents? What if a host supports only GRE? Will we have a network-informed scheduler?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Don't we need to mark 'tunnel_type' as deprecated, or we will remove tunnel_type directly? OVS plugin is the most widely used OSS plugin and I think it is better to provide a migration path. In this case 'deprecated_name' for ListOpt will work."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I agree with you. I completely forgot tunnel_type is introduced in the last vxlan patch though I reviewed it.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

I think that the patch should have a matching list of tunnel ip's."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

This is looking pretty good. I think we are waiting for an updated patch set addressing the current comments, and hopefully that will be ready to merge.

Regarding Salvatore's question, see the ml2-portbinding blueprint for how the OpenvswitchMechanismDriver, LinuxbridgeMechanismDriver, and HypervMechanismDriver will use the port's binding:host_id (set by nova) to find the AgentDb info for the L2 agent on the compute node and use this to determine whether that agent can connect to any of the segments of the port's network. For tunnels, this will include ensuring the network_type is in that agent's tunnel_types."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

One minor in-line coding suggestion to consider if updating the patch.

I agree Mathieu's comment can be addressed later. His suggestion sounds like it would work. Another option would be to use separate tunnel bridges for gre and vxlan. But its not an issue until the agent supports multiple tunnel types simultaneously. 

Longer term, I'm looking into whether eliminating the tunnel bridges and physical interface bridges would be more efficient, doing everything in br-int via flow rules."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

See my in-line comments. We need code to enforce no more than one item in tunnel_types in the agent. Contrary to other's comments, I don't think we need to bump the RPC version. Also, we may want to revisit how we deprecate enable_tunneling, and possibly introduce tunnel_type or tunnel_types on the plugin side as well."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

One minor (I think) nit in AgentNotifierApi. Other than that I'm ready to +1 this, and +2 after testing in devstack, as long as we are agreeing on the way enable_tunneling is being deprecated. The current code has the advantage of being minimal change."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(6 inline comments)

(4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Do not merge

the feature of multiple tunnel_types of ovs agent has been modified many times, and it seems we lack some careful design before modification. And I think every patch should be atomic and we should not think the later ones will fix it. If this is for ml2, please come up with a spec and show us how multiple tunnel_types work.

currently, I give -2 to expect spec'}, {'account_id': 2888, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I don't know exactly how your code behave when a vxlan tunnel and a GRE tunnel share the same tun_id, but with this code, the traffic might go to both vxlan and GRE tunnels."}, {'account_id': 2888, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

kyle, partial-mesh should be deprecated with L2-population [1] implementation. What I meant during my review is that there may be a security issue if two tunnels (one vxlan and one gre) with the same id are hosted in one agent. 
to avoid this issue, one way could be to manage one mapping of port concerned by vxlan, and one mapping of port concerned by gre, and adapt the flow by telling the egress and ingress port instead of "normal".
This kind of mapping is done in partial-mesh BP. 

May be we can keep your patch for the moment and address the vxlan and gre identical tunneling id issue in an independent bug.

[1]https://blueprints.launchpad.net/quantum/+spec/l2-population'}, {'account_id': 2888, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Modify the OVS agent to support multiple tunnel_types concurrently.

This change modifies the "tunnel_type" configuration option to be a ListOpt
instead of a StrOpt. This is intended to allow the agent to work in an ML2
environment where multiple, disparate "tunnel_types" are supported at the
same time. For now, the agent will enforce a single "tunnel_type".

Fixes bug #1191089

Change-Id: Ic025e54a8a3e92fe1fe44ebf08d71c2210c7d82b

commit_message:
Modify the OVS agent to support multiple tunnel_types concurrently.

This change modifies the "tunnel_type" configuration option to be a ListOpt
instead of a StrOpt. This is intended to allow the agent to work in an ML2
environment where multiple, disparate "tunnel_types" are supported at the
same time. For now, the agent will enforce a single "tunnel_type".

Fixes bug #1191089

Change-Id: Ic025e54a8a3e92fe1fe44ebf08d71c2210c7d82b

commit_message:
Fix duplicated hypervisor config sec, rstrctre

This patch fixes the current situation where we have two sections
regarding configuring hypervisors in compute admin guide. The section
also erroneously stated that its information was useless unless you
had a running install - fixed!

This also makes the breakdown between the default (kvm) and other
hypervisors a bit better.

fixes bug 1026674

Change-Id: I3c366913d8f5bd8ebf9779e623001b4449a10453

commit_message:
Minor fixes on the basic install guide

* Don't list the uec images, they are not used in the guide
* Use `CirrOS` instead of `Cirros` (same as install guide)
* Add missing prompts
* Hide the quantum-ovs-cleanup listitem for ubuntu/debian

PatchSet 2:

* Fix apache error log path
* Fix hostnames on network node
* Fix mysql commands for keystone database reset

Change-Id: Ia1577900f6cc2b0549a154c2e80bd84a22fa9a4d

commit_message:
Fixed commit of Galera/MySQL for HA

This is the first commit of information on installing
and configuring MySQL to use Galera for high availability
in OpenStack.  It should provide enough information to get
get users going, but may be incomplete. This commit
includes fixes based on comments.

bug #1091889
blueprint #improve-high-availability-support

Change-Id: I1d7861a3264dd6de3b4afa028b683099909bde70

commit_message:
Cleanup and make HACKING.rst DRYer

Reference the OpenStack hacking guide in HACKING.rst and remove
duplicate entries.  Add placeholder section for heat specific
rules.  heat specific rules can be created using hacking's local check
support.

Change-Id: Ib6967ae769bd73857abb7ef89368c407c8b22053

commit_message:
Raise requirements to be in sync with OpenStack/Requirements

Mainly due to the testing deps being outdated. Also
fixes client capping.

Fixes LP Bug #1200214

Change-Id: I39c18144bc19189513fc4c1f9712b8938bd719cf

As a server project, keystone should list a version number in setup.cfg
so that the version numbers products in daily tarballs list the
pre-release alpha designation.

Change-Id: I1aff86b0890f2d215d00b0c1f19cca3798ae88ec
'}]
commit_message:
Add version so that pre-release versioning works

As a server project, keystone should list a version number in setup.cfg
so that the version numbers products in daily tarballs list the
pre-release alpha designation.

Change-Id: I1aff86b0890f2d215d00b0c1f19cca3798ae88ec

commit_message:
Cleanup and make HACKING.rst DRYer

Reference the OpenStack hacking guide in HACKING.rst and remove
duplicate entries.  Add placeholder section for cinder specific rules.
cinder specific rules can be created using hacking's local check
support.

Change-Id: Ia74da70363e3fe602405a440c1d2ec75052e9193

commit_message:
Sync requirements with OpenStack Requirements

Specifically relax requirement on python-keystoneclient
in order to unbreak gating for other changes.

Change-Id: I0268f68036d81be18b9141905fb0814d7ce398db

commit_message:
Clear out service disabled reason on enable

When a service gets re-enabled, clear out the 'disabled_reason' column.

Fix bug 1197423.

Change-Id: I78c9e40c65e96fbc6eff0e3426cfd87b0810cd69

[{'created': '2013-07-10 20:18:58.000000000', 'message': 'Integrate cells start/stop with compute RPCAPI

This moves the special start/stop behavior for cells into the Compute
RPCAPI class.  Essentially this the beginnings of being able to remove
the special Cells API class.

Change-Id: Ib2b28f8446883d825876227f639561a69e8b3308
'}, {'created': '2013-07-10 23:43:17.000000000', 'message': "Better start/stop handling for cells

commit_message:
Better start/stop handling for cells

This adds separate cells calls for start/stop compute API methods that
handles objects.  This starts to move us away from the generic
'run_compute_api_method' cells call.

Change-Id: Ib2b28f8446883d825876227f639561a69e8b3308

commit_message:
Change default libvirt_vif_driver when using Quantum

As mentionned in official OpenStack Networking documentation, we should use this driver
for VIF when Quantum is installed.

docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-network/admin/content/nova_with_quantum_example.html

Change-Id: Ibf378aa0389c09628049bff5fdf1055cd1c2a926

commit_message:
Foreign key constraints are not enabled in sqlite

We can't write tests for constraints when they are turned off.

Bug 1190533

Change-Id: I74f072ef30eb5df116f27e27356253d1b6f3fe1f

Hi Doug, Thanks for review. 

The goal of such change is to make a common scheduler that could be used in cinder and nova.

Both schedulers in nova and cinder use this common manager.

commit_message:
Move common base service manager to oslo.

Some services have common settings in base manager.
For example nova.manager, cinder.manager...

This patch allow to use common manager for cert and cells in nova,
scheduler for nova and cinder.

All logic with registration services and using periodic task will
be implemented in oslo library. For successful use this functionality
some options in config should be redefined in each service:
- db_driver,
- [manager]
	serializer
	use_baserpc
- scheduler_rpcapi

Host option can be used by default.

Blueprint: oslo-base-manager

Change-Id: I24a49b8eccde2f703b7406dd27a5c32428da868f
