- http://logs.openstack.org/35817/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/28511 : SUCCESS in 45m 07s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35817/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/15103 : FAILURE in 25m 21s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-07-06 02:42:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

Regretfully had to -1 this even before running the script. Do we agree that the administrator user is NOT the swift user? You do not run saio_setup.sh as swift by any chance, do you?"}, {'account_id': 7008, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:01:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Zaitcev,

I see your points about the device names and running the script as root, and the path names are also my mistake, but I am rather confused about the username parts. 

Yes, I did design the script to be run as the user `swift` because that's the  way the instructions are worded for ubuntu. I tried and failed to install fedora as a VM on my machine.

On one hand, I couldn't think of any reason why a VM created specifically for running swift unit tests would have any users other than (root if fedora and) swift.

On the other hand, there must be a reason why the instructions bother with <your-user-name>, instead of hard-coding `swift`?

Given that installing swift via the normal package installers automatically creates the user `swift`, does installing swift from source also do so?

Could you please explain any use-cases for *not* hard-coding the `swift` user?

Thank you,
-Leah"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-14 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-14 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

script to setup SAIO, updated SAIO documentation

to be uncommented and you need to rsync the branch code to the VM's repo
when prompted.

    'm1.tiny' now has root_gb=1

    `root_gb=0` indicates that a disk-resize shouldn't occur which is not
    something that a default flavor should have enabled. This is
    especially true of one named 'tiny' since the unresized image could
    potentially be very large, leading to the unexpected result of a
    'tiny' instance consuming a massive amount of disk.

fixes bug 1195569

Change-Id: I9588ac78927e9bd69f68fa0a9478728e4e473e80

commit_message:
Update Tiny root disk to 1GB

    'm1.tiny' now has root_gb=1

    `root_gb=0` indicates that a disk-resize shouldn't occur which is not
    something that a default flavor should have enabled. This is
    especially true of one named 'tiny' since the unresized image could
    potentially be very large, leading to the unexpected result of a
    'tiny' instance consuming a massive amount of disk.

fixes bug 1195569

Change-Id: I9588ac78927e9bd69f68fa0a9478728e4e473e80

commit_message:
Changes swift xfs inode advice to be more modern

In past couple of years, the XFS team has greatly improved inode use in
xfs. With more recent kernels, there is no performance penalty for
using the default inode size, and a smaller inode size gives us
improvements in other areas where disk access is involved.

fixes bug 1195768

Change-Id: I5882cd0decf362dfa23bd2f0382f1687322a8d38

> When it matches, rootwrap would end up executing (without 
> setting environment):
> ip netns exec NS A=B C=D dnsmasq...

Right. the only problem here is that ip netns exec does not like that: 

exec of "QUANTUM_NETWORK_ID=id" failed: No such file or directory

netns exec does not do itself any shell invocation or special sudo processing. 

so we either need to call 

  ip netns exec NS env A=B C=D dnsmasq

or implement environment (and command truncation) forwarding instead.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

try e.g.

   sudo bin/quantum-rootwrap etc/rootwrap.conf ip netns exec foo   QUANTUM_NETWORK_ID=id QUANTUM_RELAY_SOCKET_PATH=/tmp  dnsmasq

which gives here: 

   exec of "QUANTUM_NETWORK_ID=id" failed: No such file or directory'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Use the common oslo-incubator rootwrap rather than maintain a
specific fork within Quantum.

- Migrated DnsmasqFilter use in dhcp.filters to the new EnvFilter
- Fixed environment passing in ip_lib's netns.execute so that
  "ip netns exec FOO dnsmasq..." can be properly matched using
  IpNetNsExecFilter + EnvFilter

- Quantum maintains a specific bin/quantum-rootwrap-xen-dom0 which
  requires additional config in rootwrap.conf

Both behaviors were preserved in this commit, but this may need to be
addressed in the future to simplify future oslo-rootwrap updates.

Implements bp: quantum-common-rootwrap

commit_message:
Import Oslo's common rootwrap to Neutron

Use the common oslo-incubator rootwrap rather than maintain a
specific fork within Neutron.

- Migrated DnsmasqFilter use in dhcp.filters to the new EnvFilter
- Changed environment passing in ip_lib's netns.execute so that
  it can be properly matched using IpNetNsExecFilter + EnvFilter.
  It now calls "ip netns exec ns env A=B C=D command" instead of
  "A=B C=D ip netns exec ns command". Adjusted tests accordingly.

All the other changes are coming directly from the Oslo "rootwrap"
module sync.

Notes:
- Neutron locates its rootwrap.conf in etc/ rather than in etc/neutron
- Neutron maintains a specific bin/quantum-rootwrap-xen-dom0 which
  requires additional config in rootwrap.conf

Both behaviors were preserved in this commit, but this may need to be
addressed in the future to simplify future oslo-rootwrap updates.

Implements bp: quantum-common-rootwrap

Change-Id: I02879942a9d1169a71aa4d684c1b9ec109a6de32

commit_message:
Ensure a name of packet filter is stored in NEC plugin

This patch fixes NEC Plugin to handle a name of packet filter and added
"name" column into PacketFilter table.

Fixes: bug #1198223
Change-Id: Ic191b2793653b41496922f2fa4be4f410d71dc64

commit_message:
Document rate limiting is per process

Since rate limiting is is done in memory, it is per process.  Document
this to warn users.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I580a4081550019914f074c8b1abdf435f3f24ca1

commit_message:
Adding multiple locations support to image downloading

Enable image domain object fetch data from multiple locations, allow API
client consume image from multiple backend store.

Implement bp: multiple-locations-downloading

Change-Id: I512e2b517ac0222339d61c490d620fc414dd8e7a
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Removed unused attributes from README

These attributes are specified in openstack-common.
Don't see why we should document them inside the wrapper,
should only document attributes the wrapper is setting

Change-Id: Ic4be7505348e0a2d52442f64bcf388f2244e11e6

commit_message:
Fix TestDhcpAgentEventHandler test that fails in some Jenkins runs.

Add mocking of check_version method that have ran dnsmasq process to retrieve version

fixes bug 1200698

Change-Id: I6476d62bc4394bdf9701a2aa26a435f8bcb00d0d

commit_message:
Add option to ignore backend HTTP error in BigSwitch plugin

This patch fixes the way the BigSwitch plugin ignores 404
errors from the backend controller by allowing HTTP codes
to be selectively ignored on REST calls. This prevents
unnecessary exception handling and failover logic in calls
where 404 codes are acceptable.

Change-Id: Ia1118c039af3b45d96fb3f8a5fb5d3febdf50f4f
Fixes: bug #1200023

Passing the information back into the store may be a good future enhancement.  However it is not the intention of this patch.  This patch is allowing the storage system to present addition information to the user to consume, and not a way to tie information to a location for its own consumption.  What you mention may very well be useful in a future patch but I would greatly prefer to not further complicate this patch with an interface change like that.'}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-07-02 04:12:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Hi John,

Just regarding the v1 locations leaking I mentioned in PS 9 - here's what reproduced it for me, will re-visit the rest of the changes soon.

* <Spin up a fresh devstack instance>
* git review -d 34492 # PS 14
* <Stop glance-registry>
* glance-manage db_sync
* <Start glance-registry>
* <Restart glance-api>
* export TOKEN=$(keystone token-get | grep ' id ' | get_field 2)
* curl -H"x-auth-token:$TOKEN" http://localhost:9292/v1/images/7144a5e6-cbb5-4ebc-8cee-3587adc38468 -v

< X-Image-Meta-Location_data: [{u'url': u'swift+http://service%3Aglance:glance@1.2.3.4:5000/v2.0/glance/7144a5e6-cbb5-4ebc-8cee-3587adc38468', u'metadata': {}}]

Note, I had to run the curl twice, it didn't seem to happen on the first try, but happens consistently thereafter.'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-07-09 19:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-07-09 19:33:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 03:47:38.000000000', 'message': "Allow storage drivers to add metadata to locations

This patches allows a storage system to add metadata to a location.
For example, if a location is a file:// URL the storage system may
wish to add information about it like the following:
{'FS': Gluster, 'mountpoint': '/usr/local/', 'namespace': 'abc-efg-xyz'}
Such information can be useful to a client with access to the direct
URL (often times the URL alone cannot encode enough information).

With this change when new data is added to the store a dictionary
is returned along with URL.  That dictionary is then stored in the
DB with the URL.  It is up to each store to determine what is in this
metadata dictionary.  Possible way to do so are with a configuration
file.  This patch does not included storage systems (other than tests)
that set this information.

If the API service is configured with the follow options:

    show_multiple_locations = True

then the location and the location information is returned with the
image information in the field 'location_data'.  location_data is
a list with the following format:

{'value': '<url>', 'metadata': <a storage specific dict>}

With this patch it will always be a list of one, but future patches
relating to the blueprint multiple-image-locations will allow for more.

blueprint: direct-url-meta-data
blueprint: multiple-image-locations

Change-Id: Ia832b8a8366bb06bfbaa53871af39a6a10b5721d

then the location and the location information is returned with the
image information in the field 'locations'.  locations is
a list with the following format:

{'url': '<url>', 'metadata': <a storage specific dict>}

With this patch it will always be a list of one, but future patches
relating to the blueprint multiple-image-locations will allow for more.

blueprint: direct-url-meta-data
blueprint: multiple-image-locations

Change-Id: Ia832b8a8366bb06bfbaa53871af39a6a10b5721d
"}, {'created': '2013-07-09 02:36:37.000000000', 'message': "Allow storage drivers to add metadata to locations

This patches allows a storage system to add metadata to a location.
For example, if a location is a file:// URL the storage system may
wish to add information about it like the following:
{'FS': Gluster, 'mountpoint': '/usr/local/', 'namespace': 'abc-efg-xyz'}
Such information can be useful to a client with access to the direct
URL (often times the URL alone cannot encode enough information).

With this change when new data is added to the store a dictionary
is returned along with URL.  That dictionary is then stored in the
DB with the URL.  It is up to each store to determine what is in this
metadata dictionary.  Possible way to do so are with a configuration
file.  This patch does not included storage systems (other than tests)
that set this information.

If the API service is configured with the follow options:

    show_multiple_locations = True

then the location and the location information is returned with the
image information in the field 'locations'.  locations is
a list with the following format:

{'url': '<url>', 'metadata': <a storage specific dict>}

With this patch it will always be a list of one, but future patches
relating to the blueprint multiple-image-locations will allow for more.

blueprint: direct-url-meta-data
blueprint: multiple-image-locations
docimpact: show_multiple_locations

commit_message:
Allow storage drivers to add metadata to locations

This patches allows a storage system to add metadata to a location.
For example, if a location is a file:// URL the storage system may
wish to add information about it like the following:
{'FS': Gluster, 'mountpoint': '/usr/local/', 'namespace': 'abc-efg-xyz'}
Such information can be useful to a client with access to the direct
URL (often times the URL alone cannot encode enough information).

With this change when new data is added to the store a dictionary
is returned along with URL.  That dictionary is then stored in the
DB with the URL.  It is up to each store to determine what is in this
metadata dictionary.  Possible way to do so are with a configuration
file.  This patch does not included storage systems (other than tests)
that set this information.

If the API service is configured with the follow options:

    show_multiple_locations = True

then the location and the location information is returned with the
image information in the field 'locations'.  locations is
a list with the following format:

{'url': '<url>', 'metadata': <a storage specific dict>}

With this patch it will always be a list of one, but future patches
relating to the blueprint multiple-image-locations will allow for more.

blueprint: direct-url-meta-data
blueprint: multiple-image-locations
docimpact: show_multiple_locations

Change-Id: Ia832b8a8366bb06bfbaa53871af39a6a10b5721d

commit_message:
Handle errors raised by extend_volume

Errors raised by extend_volume aren't handled by the manager.
This means the volume status will not be updated to 'error_extending'
when an error is raised during the process.

* Handle such errors and update volume status accordingly
* Add logging for the extend volume process

Fixes: bug #1199471
Change-Id: I06a037af0344d1eaf4115f0af5a85ceeab1ffd37

commit_message:
Add support to import images into sheepdog volumes.

Supporting import images from glance to sheepdog volumes.
Unit test framework for sheepdog is added too.

Fix Bug #1148784

Change-Id: I8ffd1bc1b2d719aed27ce0d98eaa41fef8027ca2

commit_message:
Port hide srvr addresses extension to v3 API Pt2

Ports the hide server addresses extension and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: If0df9839d897b7baf49278915f1a4948c8b6a1e4

commit_message:
Merge extension server-start-stop into servers core API v3

* Move the action 'start' and 'stop' into servers core and
the corresponding unittest.
* Add decorator extensions.expected_errors

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I94acb688e0a7975b67d652d11d315843dbdf3eb3

commit_message:
Port extended status extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the extended_status extension and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I457701a36ddafbaba89fdbe460650f2f32079987

commit_message:
update Quantum usage to Neutron

This change updates to use the neutron client library and provides
backwards compatiblity with the network_api_class.

implements bug: 1197208

Change-Id: Ia6c74e40eff516a0fcbe53fdc48e16fb0f98e864

Relax OpenStack upper capping of client versions

uncap upper keystoneclient version

Fixes: bug#1200214

commit_message:
Port os-console-output extension to API v3 Part 2

This change includes:
    - changes to os-console-output fit into api-v3
    - unit test refactor to decrease code duplication
    - change the action name to get_console_output since it is more 'compliant
with all other servers actions, using '_' to separate the words in the
request.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I075c868c3a160f06980edcc27ff22da910ff4403

Port server password extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the server password extension and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-07-05 03:26:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This solution would cause the validation of the rest resources in the stack being skipped."}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-07-05 03:44:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My comment on the bug page might be a bit confusing. By "first properties validation happening before stack creation", I mean the validation that happens when a Properties object is   instantiated in Resource.__init__.
And "The second properties validation" refers to the place where self.properties gets created again to resolve AWS::StackId pseudo parameter in Resource.create.'}, {'account_id': 7162, 'date': '2013-07-05 03:46:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

After more checking, this bug is related to bug #1192142 which is handle the resolved value is None, after that patch, I think this bug also can be resolved.
and don't have bug with skipping rest resource validation.
So I suggest postpone this bug fix and recheck after bug #1192142 approve"}, {'account_id': 7162, 'date': '2013-07-05 03:53:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, for WordPress_2_Instances_With_EBS.template, I think instance must have availability_zone or DataVolume has its default value for availability_zone, is it correct?'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-07-05 17:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
ignore AttributeNotReady when resource state is None

fixed bug #1196543

Ignore the AttributeNotReady when we do stack.validate,
the resource state is (None, None) at this moment,
so resource's Attributes would not be resolved due to
bug No. 1184794, but when we do properties.validate()
again in resource.create(), the AttributeNotReady would not
be ignored again

Change-Id: I74bd9b0b2244a96c35c3551bb4c9f227eaa1ec7a

A few notes, in no particular order:

(a) Jenkins is going to reject this since it's not pep8-compliant,

(b) any big new chunk of code like this needs unit tests, and

(c) there's some docs that need updating too, like the sample proxy-server config.

Point (a) is easy enough to fix, and you can run tox to check that stuff locally without pushing to Jenkins. That way you get results in a couple minutes, not a couple hours.

I haven't really looked at the code much, so don't take this review as exhaustive."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-01 22:00:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

The criteria on whether an object in rate limit shouldn't be in the confs like that.  Maybe do something like have a container metadata like:
x-container-meta-ratelimit-objects:10:3600

that would allow individual customers to set it per container and all objects in container would be limited. Your solution wouldn't really work when you have many customers in a cluster.

Why do you want all the statsd stuff?  Thats a lot of statsd noise imo. You will be able to scan for 498s in the proxy logs if you want to see how much it  happened.

Having a memcached key for every object doesn't bother me all that much. This is for a kinda specific use case, not CloudFiles for example, but I could see other people using it.

The code / docs need to be cleaned up and needs tests.

I haven't run it yet but those are initial thoughts."}, {'account_id': 7724, 'date': '2013-07-01 23:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-01 23:55:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-01 20:58:38.000000000', 'message': "implement a ratelimiter for objects

the existing ratelimit middleware works on a per-container level,
and causes the proxy server to sleep to force clients to slow down. it
almost never returns a 498 response.

This is something different: it's based on the assumption you already
informed your user about a rate limit on your objects.
You then limit how many times
each object (matching a certain string) can be accessed in a certain time,
The measurements are per-object and expire when no new requests have
been seen in the specified time.  Once an object is about to be
requested too often*, swift returns http 498 'rate limit reached',
instead of gently slowing down.

You can configure multiple limitations and specify a string
which must be contained within the path (including querystring) for
the setting to apply.  It falls back to the match-less version, if
specified

Configuration examples:
object_ratelimit = 10:3600
object_ratelimit_temp_url_sig = 10:3600

[*] Note that this design is a little racey and causes the actual
amount of allowed requests to be a little higher,
Note also that the counters are maintained in memcache and are subject
to purging or loss on daemon restart.
This is usually all OK if you just want to block abusers (it is for us)
and this keeps the code/design simple and efficient.

Change-Id: I36a8a59ad3199c0622f10d67613c4fc4d6eea14d
"}, {'created': '2013-07-01 21:05:33.000000000', 'message': "implement a ratelimiter for objects

You can configure multiple limitations and specify a string

the setting to apply.  It falls back to the match-less version, if
specified

Configuration examples:
> 10 reqs, TTL 3600s
object_ratelimit = 10:3600
> same, but only for req paths matching 'temp_url_sig'
object_ratelimit_temp_url_sig = 10:3600

[*] Note that this design is a little racey and causes the actual
amount of allowed requests to be a little higher,
Note also that the counters are maintained in memcache and are subject

This is usually all OK if you just want to block abusers (it is for us)
and this keeps the code/design simple and efficient.

Change-Id: I36a8a59ad3199c0622f10d67613c4fc4d6eea14d

commit_message:
implement a ratelimiter for objects

the existing ratelimit middleware works on a per-container level,
and causes the proxy server to sleep to force clients to slow down. it
almost never returns a 498 response.

This is something different: it's based on the assumption you already
informed your user about a rate limit on your objects.
You then limit how many times
each object (matching a certain string) can be accessed in a certain time,
The measurements are per-object and expire when no new requests have
been seen in the specified time.  Once an object is about to be
requested too often*, swift returns http 498 'rate limit reached',
instead of gently slowing down.

You can configure multiple limitations and specify a string
which must be contained within the path (including querystring) for
the setting to apply.  It falls back to the match-less version, if
specified

Configuration examples:
> 10 reqs, TTL 3600s
object_ratelimit = 10:3600
> same, but only for req paths matching 'temp_url_sig'
object_ratelimit_temp_url_sig = 10:3600

[*] Note that this design is a little racey and causes the actual
amount of allowed requests to be a little higher,
Note also that the counters are maintained in memcache and are subject
to purging or loss on daemon restart.
This is usually all OK if you just want to block abusers (it is for us)
and this keeps the code/design simple and efficient.

Change-Id: I36a8a59ad3199c0622f10d67613c4fc4d6eea14d

commit_message:
Adds a new param, deprecated, to the __init__() function.

Adds a new parameter, deprecated, to the list of parameters for the
__init__() function. If deprecated is set to anything other than the
default setting of None, that Opt is skipped.

Change-Id: Ice095e8a6bbf71e09b6b1e57ad8e234a82664232

commit_message:
Create implicit depends from gateway to public subnet.

Depend on any subnet in this template with the same network_id
as this network_id, as the gateway implicitly creates a port
on that subnet.

Fixes bug: #1195599

Change-Id: Ie850a82dce551d46341b1eef7f0208074b72453f

commit_message:
Register Extensions

Extensions register themselves with keystone/common/extension.py
as either public, admin, or both, and they show up in the extensions
collection on http://<hostname>:<port>/v2.0/extensions/

Bug 1177531

Change-Id: Ic0b5c84e28342e96c3197c1b46f8b1656e2d7050

commit_message:
Add ceilometerclient and bootstrap-datepicker as dependency.

Add python-ceilometerclient to the requirements.txt file
since ceilometer api depends on it.
Add bootstrap-datepicker to select date.

Implements: blueprint ceilometer

Change-Id: Ifd9c9240c770bea3304dae83d6abc79e7580a234

commit_message:
Change db.api.instance_type_ to db.api.flavor_

Rename nova.db.api and nova.db.sqlalchemy.api functions from
instance_type_ to flavor_.  Since this is a fairly large change, leave
backwards compatibility in until all dependant changes (moving code from
db.instance_type_*).

Partially implements bp flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: Ie81c66e13056537ca26ff04defdb6eb86d5c462a

commit_message:
Add info about uninstalling OpenStack

Sometimes you have to uninstall OpenStack the hard way.
This additional section explains how.

Also fixed a bug where the 'upgrades' section was at the wrong
level in the nesting tree.

fixes bug 1040046

Change-Id: Id9063b118270129e2dbcab79909fc4549a16d37b

 xenapi_disable_agent option, which this patch adds a note

commit_message:
Add note about config drive, backing storage

From Grizzly, config drive is now supported well in Xen.

However, when using it, it is important to adjust the
 xenapi_disable_agent option, which this patch adds a note
about.

patchset2 adds a new config example snippet for backing storage

patchset3 addresses Diane's comments

patchset4 fixes syntax

fixes bug 1095506
fixes bug 1085404

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/35735

Change-Id: Ica515d3d2613d6b850bf7693715cc59dff73c5b4

commit_message:
uncap python-keystoneclient version requirement

if any of the projects specify a capped client, it has the
potential for preventing that client from being tested in the
gate. To fix this we have to uncap maximum versions of all
openstack client code in all openstack projects.

Fixes bug #1200214

Change-Id: I3766477dec895011477d9520072ec04855d68a0c

commit_message:
Port hide srvr addresses extension to v3 API Pt1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ie3ca902f3e37328f59a164f15a790986b95c0155

commit_message:
Port images metadata functionality to v3 API Part 2

The images metadata functionality is moved for the V3 API from
core to an extension and is now accessed via
/os-images/{image_id}/os-image-metadata instead of
/images/{image_id}/metadata.

Consensus appears to be that we continue to need this
functionality for v3 because some deployers disable the public
image endpoint due security concerns and whether this will be
fixed in glance for Havana. Deployers can disable this extension
if they do not want it.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I13a6d049a29a452ad269dba7b59b03718ada2eab

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 18:00:17.000000000', 'message': 'Adds max-backoff for retries in Connection.

The max-backoff concept prevents the backoff used in _retry to double infinitely (which in turn causes wait times of an hour or more between retries).

Fixes: bug #1183542

Change-Id: Ic084f54069b7fa7a33604741487045c5e697ff06
'}, {'created': '2013-07-10 21:38:23.000000000', 'message': 'Adds max-backoff for retries in Connection.

commit_message:
Adds max-backoff for retries in Connection.

The max-backoff concept prevents the backoff used in _retry to double infinitely (which in turn causes wait times of an hour or more between retries).

As per review, changed code to use min instead.

Fixes: bug #1183542

Change-Id: Ic084f54069b7fa7a33604741487045c5e697ff06

commit_message:
Make notifications properly string-convert instance datetimes

Instance objects use real datetimes for launched_at and terminated_at.
This patch makes the notification information function properly
handle those.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I8622662a83ff0bdc75ffc9e267c5485925326f24

commit_message:
Fix default argument values on get_all_by_filters()

This was passing incorrect default arguments to the actual db api
method.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I8e9db96a0d3b0124b9f9431de91e8037a10abac7

commit_message:
Make db/api strip timezones for datetimes

Before objects, we always used TZ-naive dateteimes, but actually
in the UTC timezone. With objects, we use TZ-aware datetimes with
UTC as the zone. This makes the DB api strip out the timezone
before passing them to sqlalchemy, which expects naive ones.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: Id28378c6c68cabcc677bf8cf7b47a4446c397505

commit_message:
Fix object_compat decorator for non-kwargs

This makes the object_compat decorator gracefully handle the case
where a manager method gets executed with a non-kwarg instance.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I274c4f854b4c15b936bed3301e97bccbe33a44dc

commit_message:
Hook docstrings into the published docs

Fixes bug #1182842

We've always had pretty decent documentation coverage in the docstrings
but have never taken the time to hook them into the published docs.

This is a first-cut at doing that. There's plenty of rough edges, but
it's a good start.

Change-Id: I62a509e7d6e156e9b67e75bef9da68fbfc4601ac

commit_message:
Ensure that AUTHORS and ChangeLog are packaged

Include AUTHORS and ChangeLog from pbr to be included
in the sdist tarball. Add a minimal HACKING.rst for
consistency with other projects.

Fixes LP Bug #1186518

Change-Id: I0f188c1c1b449b74b43296222d33a89f98645950

There is some inconsistency with the user of identity_api.get_group() vs identity_api._get_group()

In some places you call the session-less version, in others you don't. In both you have the session. There is zero documentation on when one should call the session version vs the non-session version, the presumption being that the caller doesn't have it, even though in these cases it does."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-11 15:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Thanks Rob.  I will fix that.  In general, the session based version should only be called from within the sql idenity provider.  get_groups without the session parameter should be publically callable across drivers.  I will fix that.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-11 16:06:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-11 17:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

commit_message:
Mixed LDAP/SQL Backend.

Supports the configuration where LDAP is used for  identity and
SQL is used for assignment.

blueprint split-identity

Change-Id: Ib91b5d804282b7f78fc2458ff64653bbf2cf5d9e

Are you sure you need to mention it for upgrades?  The new behavior is consistant with and a strict superset of the old.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-07-08 16:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

well the old behaviour would have allowed to have a reseller prefix without a _ at the end (albeit mentioned in the doc that you really need one) when with this behaviour it enforce the underscore (which is what should have been).

but if a admin have previously set the reseller_prefix without a underscore it would be impossible to upgrade.

I would imagine that if someone has set it they would use it with something like swauth/tempauth or other which do enforce the _ anyway.

perhaps just a minor mention nothing critical for upgrades.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-08 21:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Works for me. At SwiftStack, we default that to "KEY_", so this change won't hurt any of our customers.

Definitely should be mentioned in the release notes though just in case there's someone out there who didn't follow the directions and decided not to use the underscore, as they'll lose access to their data.

I'm gonna leave this unapproved for a little bit to see if any such person chimes in and says this'll break his cluster. If not, it's probably fine to merge, unless someone pops up to object.'}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2013-07-08 23:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-12 20:56:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Approved

Welp, it's been four days. Ship it!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 20:56:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.

- Automatically add underscore if it wasn't there already.
- Fixes bug 1198878.

Change-Id: Ia82f14f82c380c7ed2ddd190116f1493e410cfbe
"}, {'created': '2013-07-08 11:34:00.000000000', 'message': "Make keystoneauth reseller_prefix check for _

- Automatically add underscore if there wasn't one already.
- This makes consistent with tempauth.
- Fixes bug 1198878.
- This should probably need to be mentioned in the release changelog for
  upgrades.

Change-Id: Ia82f14f82c380c7ed2ddd190116f1493e410cfbe
"}]
commit_message:
Make keystoneauth reseller_prefix check for _

- Automatically add underscore if there wasn't one already.
- This makes consistent with tempauth.
- Fixes bug 1198878.
- This should probably need to be mentioned in the release changelog for
  upgrades.

Change-Id: Ia82f14f82c380c7ed2ddd190116f1493e410cfbe

commit_message:
ceilometer tests need to be enabled/cleaned

- re-enable a bunch of tests that currently aren't being discovered
and thus never run.
- delete notificationclient and its tests since no one uses it.

Change-Id: I50ad04bc22b06c718ce47052c64c95165e54efe8
Fixes: Bug#1197545

commit_message:
Make db properties functions consistent with the DB API

Currently property related functions are not consistent with the
database API. As for the create operation, the API returns an
ImageProperty model instead of a dictionary and in the case of the
delete operation, the function expects a property instance instead of a
reference name.

This patch makes both calls consistent by returning a dictionary when a
property is created and receiving a property name instead of its
instance when a property needs to be deleted.

Fixes bug: #1199364
Implements blueprint registry-db-driver

Change-Id: Ibc7067cf712942610c7507f22f8895c2d531172a

commit_message:
Rename account.utils to common.request_helpers.

The code in there doesn't really belong in swift.account since it's
used by both the account server and the proxy, but it can't live in
common.utils since it requires swob, and that would create circular
imports.

tl;dr naming is hard

Change-Id: I866d899df2b4d39dbcedefc7f32a7904ea2504bf

commit_message:
doc auto extract archive and bulk delete middleware

Grizzly added these two new features. Add sections to the
'additional features' section of the object storage admin guide

commit_message:
Build ramdisks in an image chroot.

Ramdisks are now built inside a chroot which is built by the normal
image build process. Doing so improves our independence of the
precise state of the build host.

This fixes bug 1194055.

Change-Id: Ibc254fbb9e7b404b5f38c1b35bcde8a4136e8e28

commit_message:
Bump sqlalchemy to 0.8.99

Both Ubuntu and Debian have sqlalchemy installed by
default so this is the first step to make usuable by
Openstack.

Change-Id: I62f4acb5373af89787754764c58ed66a392832a0
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Make cloud-init-nocloud work cross-platform.

Previously debconf was used and thus this only worked on dpkg based
systems. Now we can support any system that runs a reasonably recent
cloud-init.

Change-Id: I1397aefb3af400adcfd98f858c5a32fad2b584b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 14:50:46.000000000', 'message': "Remove version caps from python-fooclient.

This removes the version caps from python-neutronclient and
python-cinderclient in Tempest. Per mailing list thread, allowing
any project to cap one of our own clients actually prevents us
from testing that client's git version in devstack gate (because
there are 2 ways to install a python client, one from git, one from
pip). This can allow bugs to creep into the clients because they are
no longer tested in the gate.

fixes bug #1200214 for Tempest

Change-Id: I00a451448ec380068905b28f3b74656c083dc261
"}, {'created': '2013-07-12 17:32:11.000000000', 'message': "Remove version caps from python-fooclient.

This removes the version caps from python-neutronclient and
python-cinderclient in Tempest. Per mailing list thread, allowing
any project to cap one of our own clients actually prevents us
from testing that client's git version in devstack gate (because
there are 2 ways to install a python client, one from git, one from
pip). This can allow bugs to creep into the clients because they are
no longer tested in the gate.

An exception is currently being made for neutron client because of
the need for an incompatible change in their next release.

Fixes bug #1200214 for Tempest

Change-Id: I00a451448ec380068905b28f3b74656c083dc261
"}]
commit_message:
Remove version caps from python-fooclient.

This removes the version caps from python-neutronclient and
python-cinderclient in Tempest. Per mailing list thread, allowing
any project to cap one of our own clients actually prevents us
from testing that client's git version in devstack gate (because
there are 2 ways to install a python client, one from git, one from
pip). This can allow bugs to creep into the clients because they are
no longer tested in the gate.

An exception is currently being made for neutron client because of
the need for an incompatible change in their next release.

Fixes bug #1200214 for Tempest

Change-Id: I00a451448ec380068905b28f3b74656c083dc261

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 22:54:28.000000000', 'message': 'Configure a heat security group for testing ssh.

This test was relying on the default security group allowing
port 22 access, which is not a default configuration.

This change adds a dedicated security group to allow the ssh
connection.

Change-Id: Ie3b0439b80ab29451f17f63f36cf8aab29f80740
'}]
commit_message:
Configure a heat security group for testing ssh.

This test was relying on the default security group allowing
port 22 access, which is not a default configuration.

This change adds a dedicated security group to allow the ssh
connection.

Change-Id: Ie3b0439b80ab29451f17f63f36cf8aab29f80740

'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-06-24 22:30:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Meh... why does heat break grenade? Shouldn't we fix that? Can we?"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-06-24 22:32:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I meant -1 earlier."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-06-24 22:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

NOPE. Now I get it. grenade starts with grizzly - which did not have heat. Duh.

Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-06-25 13:20:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's right, Monty!

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:09:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Tempest service is not enable in the list. I will send a second patch for review."}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:21:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:24:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The current structure enables heat for master, but not grizzly.  Why does it break grenade to enable heat for the new branch?"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:31:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

because we don't setup services in "new", we only run upgrade scripts (so things like config file generation doesn't happen in new). So we can't have services show up in "new" that weren't in old.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:58:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Okay, we hashed this out in IRC, and I understand now.  However, I think the devstack-gate script is written with the understanding that we would test the standard branch config for both old and new.  However, the current expectation from the grenade and tempest folks is that we just test the old branch's services.

So I think the way to address this is by just using the LOCALRC settings for the old branch for both old and new branches.  That would be a different change which adalbas is going to work on."}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-06-25 15:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

James

Agreed. Not only the localrc but also the enabled services should be set according to old.

commit_message:
Enable services for gate-grenade-devstack-vm

We don't need heat running for grenade in the gate.
But we need tempest and we need the same services
running for both the old and new devstack in grenade.
The logic for grenade is done separately here.

Fix bug 1193371
Fix bug 1193378

Change-Id: Ieb5498a69aec7b8c2d2b48e2ae89ad97a086e87e

subject: Qpid multi-host should use SERVICE_HOST variable instead of QPID_HOST
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 6473, 'name': 'Sunil Thaha', 'email': 'sthaha@redhat.com', 'username': 'sthaha'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7231, 'name': 'Jason Dillaman', 'username': 'jdillaman', 'inactive': True}]

'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-07-12 04:06:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

sometimes devstack wants globals like this defined as defaults at the top, but it doesn't seem to fit with the rest of the file.  I'm ambivalent"}, {'account_id': 6473, 'date': '2013-07-12 04:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-12 15:07:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Just curious...https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36622/ addresses this by setting a default value for QPID_HOST, although I'd suggest it use $SERVICE_HOST as the default.

Is requiring QPID_HOST to be always set preferable even in single-host configs?"}, {'account_id': 7231, 'date': '2013-07-12 15:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There have been a couple reviews which default QPID_HOST to localhost. I personally don't like the idea of defaulting the environment variable within the block as in review 36622, but you cannot default it near the top of the file (like other variables are handled) unless you wrap it with a "is_service_enabled" conditional.'}, {'account_id': 7231, 'date': '2013-07-12 15:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 16:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36717/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/31664 : SUCCESS in 43m 47s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36717/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/31357 : SUCCESS in 56m 15s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36717/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/3026 : SUCCESS in 17m 59s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36717/2/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/17677 : SUCCESS in 17m 11s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-12 17:33:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-12 17:37:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

"Is requiring QPID_HOST to be always set preferable even in single-host configs?"

The services usually has the default localhost if we do not change it by devstack.
but simpler to always specify, than adding a tricky condition.

-1: do have doubts is the SERVICE_HOST is the variable, what you need in a multi-node setup for QPID.'}, {'account_id': 7231, 'date': '2013-07-12 18:39:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Prefer to use https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36622/'}]

[{'created': '2013-07-11 19:15:34.000000000', 'message': 'Only populate qpid_hostname config property if QPID_HOST variable provided

The changes implemented in bug #1196521 for multi-host Qpid
support will break RPC if the QPID_HOST variable is not populated.

Fixes bug #1200343

Change-Id: Ie29641932d3c8297ff1f64f895aa7ab070a6bcba
'}, {'created': '2013-07-12 15:17:43.000000000', 'message': 'Qpid multi-host should use SERVICE_HOST variable instead of QPID_HOST

The changes implemented in bug #1196521 for multi-host Qpid
support will break RPC if the QPID_HOST variable is not populated.
In an effort to fix this issue, it would also be nicer to re-use the
existing SERVICE_HOST variable in support of Qpid multi-host
deployment.

Fixes bug #1200343

Change-Id: Ie29641932d3c8297ff1f64f895aa7ab070a6bcba
'}]
commit_message:
Qpid multi-host should use SERVICE_HOST variable instead of QPID_HOST

The changes implemented in bug #1196521 for multi-host Qpid
support will break RPC if the QPID_HOST variable is not populated.
In an effort to fix this issue, it would also be nicer to re-use the
existing SERVICE_HOST variable in support of Qpid multi-host
deployment.

Fixes bug #1200343

Change-Id: Ie29641932d3c8297ff1f64f895aa7ab070a6bcba

commit_message:
Wait until quantum resources are deleted.

Races on delete have occured where a quantum resource cannot
be deleted due to an associated resource delete being incomplete.

Fixes bug: #1195596

Change-Id: I52a358d05d30b9c50a771864d036156f00df67ab

[{'created': '2013-07-10 01:55:50.000000000', 'message': "Add back tempest helper script

This commit adds back the tempest helper script that
was removed in commit:
  e6c28fdcf7ab1019b77530af91afda736082f8d9

This script was removed citing that we should
use the tempest way of installing deps (tox).

After many,many hours, I cannot figure out how to get
tox working (it somehow messes us my VM network when it runs).
I can however run this simple script to
install the deps to run tempest.

Tox/requirement.txt also install the 'tempest' version of client
libraries, which is undesirable for my use case where I want to
test that a set of packages install the environment correctly.

Change-Id: I489f154a577676d439991687a5bf452ee717f115
"}]
commit_message:
Add back tempest helper script

This commit adds back the tempest helper script that
was removed in commit:
  e6c28fdcf7ab1019b77530af91afda736082f8d9

This script was removed citing that we should
use the tempest way of installing deps (tox).

After many,many hours, I cannot figure out how to get
tox working (it somehow messes us my VM network when it runs).
I can however run this simple script to
install the deps to run tempest.

Tox/requirement.txt also install the 'tempest' version of client
libraries, which is undesirable for my use case where I want to
test that a set of packages install the environment correctly.

Change-Id: I489f154a577676d439991687a5bf452ee717f115

commit_message:
Fix neutron-openvswitch-agent.service on fedora

The service is unable start because the neutron
user is unable to sudo.

Fixes: bug #1200409

Change-Id: Id22e3dd46226f6c4151b81a03c268ae5583d98f5

subject: Set SELinux to permissive in Fedora, like in RHEL.
messages:
[{'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-07-12 16:00:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

David, there have been past discussions on the topic and a generally considered better approach is to change any run time parameter required for devstack to execute successfully when selinux is in enforcing mode, at least on Fedora. Changes needed to make that happen will be considered for inclusion.

In RHEL the policy is more restrictive and updated less frequently so temporary measures could be needed."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 16:08:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/36850/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/31676 : FAILURE in 3m 20s

"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-12 16:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

RHEL6 has an exception to this primarily to support using it (CentOS 6 actually) for py26 testing.  That took priority; RHEL 7 will leave selinux enforcing as Fedora does today.'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-07-12 17:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-12 15:53:17.000000000', 'message': "Set SELinux to permissive in Fedora, like in RHEL.

SELinux complicates getting things working, and we don't get very
much security benefit in devstack since the OpenStack daemons aren't
setup confined anyway.  Of course we prefer to leave it on in
real production OpenStack instaces, but devstack is for development.

Change-Id: Ifc4c83314380f9217d4e5ca525122a8ed4e9d955
"}]
commit_message:
Set SELinux to permissive in Fedora, like in RHEL.

SELinux complicates getting things working, and we don't get very
much security benefit in devstack since the OpenStack daemons aren't
setup confined anyway.  Of course we prefer to leave it on in
real production OpenStack instaces, but devstack is for development.

Change-Id: Ifc4c83314380f9217d4e5ca525122a8ed4e9d955

In the 51-grub hook, after the GRUB installation, the script will look
for a GRUB configuration file and in case it's not present one will
be generated using the grub-mkconfig command. The reason why it have
to be done is because the new Fedora 19 cloud images is using extlinux
by default.

Change-Id: I80b15b3122698d98ac4d47dc06faf5909a90ab00
"}]
commit_message:
F19 GRUB configuration file

In the 51-grub hook, after the GRUB installation, the script will look
for a GRUB configuration file and in case it's not present one will
be generated using the grub-mkconfig command. The reason why it have
to be done is because the new Fedora 19 cloud images is using extlinux
by default.

Change-Id: I80b15b3122698d98ac4d47dc06faf5909a90ab00

Why is there a separate API operation for live_snapshot vs snapshot?  I'm assuming there must be a good reason to explicitly request a live vs a cold snapshot?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-07-03 18:23:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Brian: I brought it up in the nova channel before I started working on it. My initial hope was just to add a separate flag to the snapshot command with fallback to a regular snapshot if it wasn't supported.

This seems a bit surprising to users though. They should get a failure if they attempt to live snapshot and it isn't supported. Because we have to support both requests it seemed cleaner to keep everything separated.

That said, it would be fairly easy to add support on the client side as nova image-create --live, although i don't know if that is really better than nova live-image-create"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-07-03 20:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add support for live_snapshot in compute

This adds live_snapshot support to the compute api, the compute
manager, and the driver interface. The api extension and an
implementation for libvirt will come in follow-on-patches.

Part of blueprint live-snapshot-vms

Change-Id: I0be54d1bbe6057dbaf497b0b71cf68658c0b1832

commit_message:
Remove api = apiName calls from each method

As discussed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36352/ for each
command, we were setting api = identity or volume... etc,
this was for an old way of calling commands that are is no longer
used.

Also removed openstackclient/common/command.py

Change-Id: I2705f35d343f2ae729dc22d6aed0b852b2f8ca19

commit_message:
Fedora 19 GRUB config file

On Fedora 19 cloud image the /boot/grub2/grub.cfg file has been moved
to /boot/grub/grub.conf.

Change-Id: I48143f0470c36e5cbf1310b39a28195f4fb97eda

commit_message:
Cells: Make bandwidth_update_interval configurable

Bandwidth updates have been known to cause queues to backup. This
configuration provides a way to throttle or disable bandwidth updates as
necessary.

Fixes bug 1199899

Change-Id: Ic57e6e3915a9b97155b9fd677e1b96e6aaadb17e

subject: disable selinux on all fedora based distros
messages:
[{'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-07-10 10:02:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 11:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36422/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/30263 : SUCCESS in 47m 46s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36422/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/29967 : SUCCESS in 49m 00s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36422/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/1470 : SUCCESS in 25m 17s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36422/2/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/16416 : FAILURE in 25m 28s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-07-10 12:36:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

what's the problem you're hitting?  horizon seems to be the main problem area"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-07-10 12:56:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ian, the particular issue relates to the default security context assigned to files which aren't in the default ^/home path

This said, the need for this change really isn't to fix the particular issue but rather an attempt not to deal with any selinux security issue which could raise on a development environment where so many services are deployed from git and run with in a mixed user/root permission context"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-10 15:17:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

We have been down this path multiple times before and the conclusion has always been to leave selinux in enforcing mode.  The integration work to make (horizon in this case) functional under selinux needs to be done some time, and while DevStack is not necessarily the right place to solve packaging problems it is the right place to work those out if they happen to have impact on the projects directly.

This is a significant change and I do not want to proceed with it on an assumption without some discussion, particularly with those whom it will impact.  Maybe bring it up on the -dev ML (to catch those Fedora/RHEL devs who may not be watching the DevStack commit queue) if you feel strongly that this is the right thing to do?'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-07-11 00:00:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think that's probably the issue we saw that 

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33394/

was checking for.  maybe we should just resurrect that but just enable the httpd permissions?"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-07-11 04:22:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Ian: I was aware of that problem but really it is not that particular issue I'm trying to work around here

@Dean: I agree with you on the idea that this isn't a trivial change and I will try to raise it on the public -dev list. Still, you may notice from the change we were disabling selinux on centos/rhel already. This is just extending it to fedora."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-07-12 15:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

this is abandoned in favor of a different (and generally considered better) approach which consists of adding in devstack the changes required for it to work with selinux in enforcing mode'}]

commit_message:
disable selinux on all fedora based distros

disables selinux on any fedora based distro on the assumption that
it is not worth having it in a development environment

Change-Id: I46ec6cb35cdbe640120cf919386ad564404c45a8

subject: make internal client metadata methods return dicts with lower case keys
messages:
[{'account_id': 1009, 'date': '2013-07-09 20:32:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Some change (maybe the change from webob to swob) caused account/container metadata to be returned in mixed case.

Since the keys were not explicitly lowercased by the internal client, this resulted in the mixed case keys being returned from the internal client metadata methods.  (Which is not the desired or old behavior.)

(And, if a reviewer checks, internal client is not used anywhere in swift.  However, it's used by some projects outside of swift.)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-09 20:49:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Allow target exercises to run independently

Both target and base exercises will run according to the value
set by RUN_EXERCISES. For the gate job, we need the target
exercises to run out of the grenade.sh script.
This patch also defaults the smoke tests to False. They
will also be triggered by the gate scripts.

Blueprint nightly-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: I325d025cec6bacfa2bd7f3b48bed4a4abdacef76

commit_message:
On deleting an image, its image_tags are not deleted.

When the image is deleted, the delete operation also marks all the images' tags for deletion.

Fixes bug 1195346

Change-Id: I9958079437840860264648a8b0ce2ec2ff7a30d6

commit_message:
Pass on arguments on Base.get_session

This change makes it so that the arguments for the session
creation function get_session() get passed on when it calls the
function to create the session.

Change-Id: I2f889ab36bd3aa3bf4441a13eb2b610b54349cbb

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(18 inline comments)

+1 comes from +2 for the code and -1 for the grammar!

The gist of this change is that all the information needed by the dhcp agent is now retrieved in a single API call.
This is also consistent with the synchronization process for the L3 agent. This reduces the chatter a lot; the downside is that the payload of a single response is quite big, and that get_all_network_info might take a long time to complete, with a risk of HTTP timeouts.
However, this is still better than the previous approach, where DHCP agent startup would be have been very slow at big scales.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (18 inline comments)

(2 inline comments)

1. there is no need to change the interface between dhcp agent and uantum server: for example create_dhcp_port and update_dhcp_port. why cannot do on quantum server by previous get_dhcp_port()?
2. we can improve the performance of get_active_networks() so that it returns all related stuff of networks just we do by get_all_network_info(). So we don't need to add this method too. In addition, the get_all_network_infos does not consider the agent scheduler"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (6 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Hi gongysh, 

1. there is no need to change the interface between dhcp agent and uantum server: for example create_dhcp_port and update_dhcp_port. why cannot do on quantum server by previous get_dhcp_port()?

[arosen] - previously, the dhcp agent did a call to quantum-server for each network 'get_dhcp_port()' even if it didn't need to do that. This can be figured out on the client side. In a large deployment if you restart the dhcp agent it has to do a GET request for every network which will take a long time for the dhcp agent to get to the point where he can start handling new requests. 


2. we can improve the performance of get_active_networks() so that it returns all related stuff of networks just we do by get_all_network_info(). So we don't need to add this method too. In addition, the get_all_network_infos does not consider the agent scheduler

[arosen] - thanks for pointing this out. I did not realize my change broken this!"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Improve DHCP agent performance

Previously when starting the dhcp agent the sync_state() process would
be extremely expensive as it would query quantum server for each network.
In order to improve performance a get_active_networks_info() was added
so this information could be retrieved in one query rather than doing a
query for each active network.

The second part of this patch optimizes the logic to avoid calling
get_dhcp_port(). Previously, this method was called once for each network
which makes a call to get_subnets() and get_ports() unnecessarily as
the dhcp agent can determine itself if it needs to update a port or create a
port for dhcp.

This patch also threads the inital sync process and maintains backwards
compatibility with the previous rpc api.

There was also a trivial change to the nvp_plugin where filters are assumed to
be a dict.

implements blueprint improve-dhcp-agent-performance

Change-Id: I3b631057f595250dad76516faa9b421789f60953

In order to improve performance a get_all_network_info() was added
so this information could be retrieved in one query rather than a query
for each active network.

The second part of this patch optimizes the logic to avoid calling
get_dhcp_port(). Perviously, this method was called once for each network
which makes a call to get_subnets() and get_ports() unnecessarily as
the dhcp agent can determine itself if it needs to update a port or create a
port for dhcp.

This patch also threads the inital sync process.

There was also a trivial change to the nvp_plugin where filters is assumed to
be a dict().

implements blueprint improve-dhcp-agent-performance

Change-Id: I3b631057f595250dad76516faa9b421789f60953

commit_message:
Improve DHCP agent performance

Previously when starting the dhcp agent the sync_state() process would
be extremely expensive as it would query quantum server for each network.
In order to improve performance a get_active_networks_info() was added
so this information could be retrieved in one query rather than doing a
query for each active network.

The second part of this patch optimizes the logic to avoid calling
get_dhcp_port(). Previously, this method was called once for each network
which makes a call to get_subnets() and get_ports() unnecessarily as
the dhcp agent can determine itself if it needs to update a port or create a
port for dhcp.

This patch also threads the inital sync process and maintains backwards
compatibility with the previous rpc api.

There was also a trivial change to the nvp_plugin where filters are assumed to
be a dict.

implements blueprint improve-dhcp-agent-performance

Change-Id: I3b631057f595250dad76516faa9b421789f60953

commit_message:
Add note about config drive, backing storage

From Grizzly, config drive is now supported well in Xen.

However, when using it, it is important to adjust the
 xenapi_disable_agent option, which this patch adds a note
about.

patchset2 adds a new config example snippet for backing storage

patchset3 addresses Diane's comments

patchset4 fixes syntax

fixes bug 1095506
fixes bug 1085404

Change-Id: Ica515d3d2613d6b850bf7693715cc59dff73c5b4

'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-11 18:26:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I think there's a test missing, which is why the -1. 

But overall, while I see what's going on here, I think it's really on negligible value in the real-world. Can you get a reliable rate-of-change just from the previous data point? Depending on the Metric being measured it could have all kinds of crazy fluctuations. A sliding window average would do a much better job and remove outliers. 

Yes, this could be added to this module, but is this really what we're trying to achieve with Ceilometer? It would be better to make a pipeline exporter to Reimann.io and write the rate of change back into CM from there. 

Side note on the automated tests: These are really more integration tests. Unit tests should really map to the new methods introduced. It makes it difficult to follow when there's so much external setup required that's outside the branch."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-11 21:38:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-11 21:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-11 21:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

@sandywalsh: I take your point that a sliding window with chaotic datapoints removed would be better.

But the primary goal of this patch was simply to be a generic replacement for the existing CPUPollster logic around the calculation of the derived cpu_util counter.

So first priority is parity with the existing code, but certainly your suggestions could be built upon in a later patch.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-11 23:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-05 10:04:48.000000000', 'message': 'Transformer to perform sampling.

Addresses BP transformer-unit

Provide a new transformer to emit derived counters that sample
the rate of change of existing counters, by retaining the previous
volume and timestamp.

This transformer will supercede the direct emission of derived counters
by pollsters (e.g. cpu_util calculated by the compute CPUPollster).

The target counters are identified either by name.

The scaling can be expressed as either a straight multiplicative
factor or as a string expression to be eval'd.

Configured as per usual via the pipeline.yaml, for example:

    transformers:
        - name: "sampling_conversion"
          parameters:
              source:
                  name: "cpu"
              target:
                  name: "cpu_util"
                  unit: "%"
                  type: "gauge"
                  scale: "100 * (1.0 / counter.resource_metadata.get('cpu_number', 1))"
              replace: False

Change-Id: I0affa8d13a4fd72db08f818db809023d2f74217a
'}, {'created': '2013-07-05 17:12:35.000000000', 'message': 'Transformer to perform sampling.

commit_message:
Transformer to measure rate of change

Addresses BP transformer-unit

Provide a new transformer to emit derived counters that represent
the rate of change of existing counters, by retaining the previous
volume and timestamp.

This transformer will supercede the direct emission of derived counters
by pollsters (e.g. cpu_util calculated by the compute CPUPollster).

The target counters are identified either by name.

The scaling can be expressed as either a straight multiplicative
factor or as a string expression to be eval'd.

Configured as per usual via the pipeline.yaml, for example:

    counters:
        - "cpu"
    transformers:
        - name: "rate_of_change"
          parameters:
              target:
                  name: "cpu_util"
                  unit: "%"
                  type: "gauge"
                  scale: "100.0 * (10**9 / resource_metadata.get('cpu_number', 1))"
              replace: False

Change-Id: I0affa8d13a4fd72db08f818db809023d2f74217a

commit_message:
Image builder improvement

Add VM_IMG_FORMAT to specify VM image format at build time.
Usage:
  env VM_IMG_FORMAT=qcow2 make ws-2012-std

Change-Id: Icbe8008a52639808a73af9838d276bc547dabcf1

It looks good, I like the tests, it's all nice!

One question:
  Maybe I missed something, but I don't really understand why would you need that extra logic to define the splitting point based on the modulo 1024 of the requested size."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-24 10:00:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

So the reason for doing 1024 size disks, while not strictly needed just makes the disk split nicer.

If you go for 4000 GB, you get two disks, 2000GB each, and if you go for 2048GB disk you get two 1024GB disks, instead of a 2000GB disk and a 48GB disk. Not sure we will ever get that logic correct for everyone, but there seems resistance to adding a setting to allow the admin to choose the split point. So this covers the two cases I see where we could easily get a nice split.

Part of my thinks you could try find some way to divide up the disk.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-24 10:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

... divide up the disk equally, but that will just get too messy I think.

I want to try this simpler solution and see if it works out OK. We can always revisit this.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-24 13:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-24 14:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Works for me

commit_message:
xenapi: support ephemeral disks bigger than 2TB

The VHD format, as implemented in XenAPI, has a hard limit
of 2043GB.

This change ensures if you request an ephemeral disk
greater than this size, multiple disks are attached
to fulfill the space requested in the flavor.

By default each disk is 2000 GB in size, unless
the size in the flavor is a multiple of 1024, then
each disk is 1024 GB in size.

Implements blueprint xenapi-large-ephemeral-disk-support
Change-Id: I98d928c022bf8f2ac3f6530aac398d5cc77cdb2a

commit_message:
Remove get_counter_names from the pollster plugins

Now that there is only one meter-type coming out of
each plugin, we can use the plugin name instead of
asking the plugin which counters it produces.

blueprint one-meter-per-plugin

Change-Id: I63328b1bb2a2440771d9f1f007ff69e717d3090f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

'}, {'account_id': 6650, 'date': '2013-06-05 14:19:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

On second glance, maybe we want to have a list of endpoint priorities you could configure????   

So a user could configure to use endpoints in a certain order:
1) adminURL
2) internalURL
3) publicURL
..... etc.  

And the url_for method would walk down the list until it finds one.  If the calling method passed a flag to give the adminURL - then that URL MUST be returned.

Would that be better?'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-06-11 17:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Conceptually, I agree.  In practice, this is a more invasive changes that muddies the logic in several places.  And as an operator would I really need to fall back twice?  I would prefer to keep the logic cleaner for now and rework if the need arises.'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2013-06-12 05:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7541, 'date': '2013-07-12 13:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I liked Eric's suggestion to keep a single parameter but making it an ordered list of options that would be tried.  It would allow more flexibility in the future rather than limiting to just 2.  What you have done will suffice, though.

Also, the local_settings.py.sample file shows the same value for both types - "publicURL".  Wouldn't it be preferable for the "SECONDARY" value to be different from the primary, even if its just a commented-out example setting?'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-04 23:25:12.000000000', 'message': "Refactoring url_for to remove admin parameter

Removed unused admin parameter that was unused and removed tests
that were no longer necessary.

Added an option configuration setting SECONDARY_ENDPOINT_TYPE that
will be attempted if the OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE does not exist
in the service catalog for the desired service.

The primary use case for this fix is in cloud configurations
where Keystone does not return all endpoint types for each
service, and only does so based on the user's privilege level.

Example use case would be set OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE to 'adminURL'
and set SECONDARY_ENDPOINT_TYPE to 'publicURL'.  If adminURL is not
available to the user, then they get the publicURL back.

If SECONDARY_ENDPOINT_TYPE is not set in the settings, then the
current behavior is maintained.

Fixes: bug #1186379

Change-Id: Ieefb6ed5dd88e5c840ef6bad93ae87237a1b63f9
"}]
commit_message:
Refactoring url_for to remove admin parameter

Removed unused admin parameter that was unused and removed tests
that were no longer necessary.

Added an option configuration setting SECONDARY_ENDPOINT_TYPE that
will be attempted if the OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE does not exist
in the service catalog for the desired service.

The primary use case for this fix is in cloud configurations
where Keystone does not return all endpoint types for each
service, and only does so based on the user's privilege level.

Example use case would be set OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE to 'adminURL'
and set SECONDARY_ENDPOINT_TYPE to 'publicURL'.  If adminURL is not
available to the user, then they get the publicURL back.

If SECONDARY_ENDPOINT_TYPE is not set in the settings, then the
current behavior is maintained.

Fixes: bug #1186379

Change-Id: Ieefb6ed5dd88e5c840ef6bad93ae87237a1b63f9

commit_message:
Port extended-availability-zone API into v3 part2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the
extended-availability-zone extension and the corresponding
unittest to the v3 framework.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ifa9b8a0ddb1c5a297d6fcddbaea476192f339784

commit_message:
port Host API into v3 part2

this port host api into v3, and fix the xml/json inconsistance issue
in it.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning
Partially implements: bp v3-api-inconsistencies

Change-Id: I8a9ca6765f448f787fd69ff1cb0f8f9e6e315522

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-03 22:12:40.000000000', 'message': "Optionally store Events in Collector.

This will store the raw event in the Events table if enabled.

There are a few caveats:
1. It seems somewhere in the rpc layer is eating any exception
   being raised from the notification handler, so the ack() handling
   code isn't being reached. This will need to be fixed in oslo.

2. notification delivery_info is being stripped from the notification
   before the handler is called. This means we can't get any routing
   info on the notification (which queue did it come in on, for example).
   Again, this will need to be fixed in oslo.

3. The raw json of the event is not currently stored. The model will need
   to be extended to support this. Next.

Change-Id: Id4687e075e04278d1db6e8acc805c3fed2bd07bb
"}, {'created': '2013-07-10 15:24:15.000000000', 'message': "Optionally store Events in Collector.

commit_message:
Optionally store Events in Collector.

Blueprint collector-stores-events

This will store the raw event in the Events table if enabled.

There are a few caveats:
1. It seems somewhere in the rpc layer is eating any exception
   being raised from the notification handler, so the ack() handling
   code isn't being reached. This will need to be fixed in oslo.

2. notification delivery_info is being stripped from the notification
   before the handler is called. This means we can't get any routing
   info on the notification (which queue did it come in on, for example).
   Again, this will need to be fixed in oslo.

3. The raw json of the event is not currently stored. The model will need
   to be extended to support this. Next.

Change-Id: Id4687e075e04278d1db6e8acc805c3fed2bd07bb

commit_message:
New API v2.0

Introduced single endpoint for  services. Old endpoints is still available.
Added support for traverse feature for services.
Added ability to change any attribute on any service with one call

Change-Id: I06ad372ea6f15587d8a4e97d01820b4190172a59

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 16:16:25.000000000', 'message': 'Raise testrepository requirement to >= 0.0.15

It has full python3 support and actually fixes a weird
exception in utf8 encoding/decoding. Only noteworthy
change is documented in NEWS:

``--full-results`` is now a no-op, use ``--subunit`` to get unfiltered
  output. (Robert Collins)

Change-Id: I8c1393371e80338179135c416d93a68d7879af4f
'}]
commit_message:
Raise testrepository requirement to >= 0.0.15

It has full python3 support and actually fixes a weird
exception in utf8 encoding/decoding. Only noteworthy
change is documented in NEWS:

``--full-results`` is now a no-op, use ``--subunit`` to get unfiltered
  output. (Robert Collins)

Change-Id: I8c1393371e80338179135c416d93a68d7879af4f

commit_message:
Add unique constraints to AggregateHost.

Added unique constraint 'uniq_aggregate_hosts0host0aggregate_id0deleted'
('host', 'aggregate_id', 'deleted') to AggregateHost model and migrate
scripts.

The implementation of aggregate_host_add() in sqlalchemy.api rewritten.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: If4a6c437d5d4984a6d7ebddfd0924f211533851f
