Looks good, one question inline; would be nice if we could simplify this to just one format if possible.'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:52:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Sorry for the late reply, I have just come back from an emergent leave.
After a deep look at the ZMQ implementation, I am doubting whether the naming convention is the root cause. In cinder/service.py, for Line 377 self.conn.create_consumer(self.topic, rpc_dispatcher, fanout=False) and Line 380 self.conn.create_consumer(node_topic, rpc_dispatcher, fanout=False), the only difference is the first parameter, one is self.topic and the other is node_topic. 
If they are running under CONF.rpc_backend == 'cinder.openstack.common.rpc.impl_zmq', self.conn.create_consumer(node_topic, rpc_dispatcher, fanout=False) will become useless, because Line 625 topic = '.'.join((topic.split('.', 1)[0], CONF.rpc_zmq_host)) in cinder/openstack/common/rpc/impl_zmq.py will give out the same value for topic, so no new topic is added into self.topics and self.reactor register nothing new, even though param node_topic is different from param self.topic.  
IMO, Line 625 'topic = '.'.join((topic.split('.', 1)[0], CONF.rpc_zmq_host))' also needs to change to 'topic = '.'.join((topic, CONF.rpc_zmq_host))' to differentiate param self.topic and node_topic."}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-07-10 15:15:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Just give me one more day for this patch."}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-07-11 12:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: No score

I tested the bug today and discovered something more. My conclusion is that the reason for this bug is not the naming convention and I guess it is due to the consumer register in create_consumer in impl_zmq.py. Unfortunately I have locked the exact reason for it.

I pasted a very long comment in https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1166899. And I need the comments from anyone, who is the expert in the part of zeromq implementation.'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-07-11 12:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I tested the bug today and discovered something more. My conclusion is that the reason for this bug is not the naming convention and I guess it is due to the consumer register in create_consumer in impl_zmq.py. Unfortunately I have locked the exact reason for it.

I pasted a very long comment in https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1166899 and I need the comments from anyone, who is the expert in the part of zeromq implementation.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-07-11 19:59:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Do not merge

Are you abandoning it, is it a WIP?"}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-07-12 08:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-07-12 08:51:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-07-12 09:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Abandoned'}]

"}, {'created': '2013-07-12 08:44:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the multi-backend storge issue for ZMQ.

This issue is not caused by the naming convention as described in Bug 1166899,
but due to the incorrect node_topic registration in ZMQ.

What have been done in this patch:
*Import the latest impl_zmq.py from oslo.
*Remove self.manager.init_host(). This line will cause error, if ZMQ is chosen
as the MQ.
*Change the delimiter from "." to ":" between topic and host. "." will make
node_topic an invalid key for the registration in ZMQ.
*The node_topic should be registered correctly via
topic = '.'.join((topic, CONF.rpc_zmq_host)) in impl_zmq.py.

Fixed Bug 1166899.

Change-Id: I2f1d4524e8bc0d98c433a8179d332daa134a9acc
'}, {'created': '2013-07-12 08:51:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the multi-backend storge issue for ZMQ.

but due to the incorrect node_topic registration in ZMQ.

What have been done in this patch:
*Import the latest impl_zmq.py from oslo.
*Remove self.manager.init_host(). This line will cause error, if ZMQ is chosen
as the MQ.
*Change the delimiter from "." to ":" between topic and host. "." will make
node_topic an invalid key for the registration in ZMQ.
*The node_topic should be registered correctly via
topic = '.'.join((topic, CONF.rpc_zmq_host)) in impl_zmq.py.

Fixed Bug 1166899.

Change-Id: I2f1d4524e8bc0d98c433a8179d332daa134a9acc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the multi-backend storge issue for ZMQ.

This issue is not caused by the naming convention as described in Bug 1166899,
but due to the incorrect node_topic registration in ZMQ.

What have been done in this patch:
*Import the latest impl_zmq.py from oslo.
*Remove self.manager.init_host(). This line will cause error, if ZMQ is chosen
as the MQ.
*Change the delimiter from "." to ":" between topic and host. "." will make
node_topic an invalid key for the registration in ZMQ.
*The node_topic should be registered correctly via
topic = '.'.join((topic, CONF.rpc_zmq_host)) in impl_zmq.py.

Fixed Bug 1166899.

Change-Id: I2f1d4524e8bc0d98c433a8179d332daa134a9acc

[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor unit tests for NEC Plugin

blueprint nec-plugin-test-coverage

This commit refactors the base class of unit tests for NEC Plugin to
make writing new tests easier.

Add fake OFC Manager and change unit tests which use OFC Manager mock
to using this fake.  With this fake, we don't need to set return_value
and side_effect to the mock instance of OFC Manager in each test case.
This fake keeps all resources on OFC, and returns existence of
resources properly.  This fake is attached to OFC Manager mock instance
by setting all side_effects.  We can also set it to raise an exception.

Make NEC Plugin configurable in each test case.  Now we can configure
NEC Plugin by setting string in class value "_nec_ini" which will be
written into a temporal file and loaded by NEC plugin.

Move setup for callbacks into NecPluginV2TestCase() so that other unit
tests can use callbacks.

Change-Id: I3a52423bb5813547345677dc49abfea6563dd6cd

commit_message:
Refactor unit tests for NEC Plugin

blueprint nec-plugin-test-coverage

This commit refactors the base class of unit tests for NEC Plugin to
make writing new tests easier.

Add fake OFC Manager and change unit tests which use OFC Manager mock
to using this fake.  With this fake, we don't need to set return_value
and side_effect to the mock instance of OFC Manager in each test case.
This fake keeps all resources on OFC, and returns existence of
resources properly.  This fake is attached to OFC Manager mock instance
by setting all side_effects.  We can also set it to raise an exception.

Make NEC Plugin configurable in each test case.  Now we can configure
NEC Plugin by setting string in class value "_nec_ini" which will be
written into a temporal file and loaded by NEC plugin.

Move setup for callbacks into NecPluginV2TestCase() so that other unit
tests can use callbacks.

Change-Id: I3a52423bb5813547345677dc49abfea6563dd6cd

commit_message:
Make sure plugins are named after their meters

Update the floating ip plugin name.

The instance_flavor plugin can't really be named for
its meter, so leave that one alone.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 15:17:03.000000000', 'message': "Fixes image-download error of v2

When trying to retrieve a Glance image using the v2 api, user will
get an error:

'utf8' codec can't decode byte 0xcc in position 1217: invalid continuation byte

This is because Glance client expects a response of type content-type:
application/octet-stream but it's getting a Content-Type:

text/html; charset=UTF-8 Transfer-Encoding: chunked

The root cause is Glance will return the image data from cache if
there is. However, in method _process_v2_request, the content type
has never been configured. See:
https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/middleware/cache.py#L162

Fixes bug: 1193310

Change-Id: Icab5e28db63455358ab3919bd94c484411987e39

commit_message:
Fixes image-download error of v2

When trying to retrieve a Glance image using the v2 api, user will
get an error:

'utf8' codec can't decode byte 0xcc in position 1217: invalid continuation byte

This is because Glance client expects a response of type content-type:
application/octet-stream but it's getting a Content-Type:

text/html; charset=UTF-8 Transfer-Encoding: chunked

The root cause is Glance will return the image data from cache if
there is. However, in method _process_v2_request, the content type
has never been configured. See:
https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/middleware/cache.py#L162

Fixes bug 1193310

Change-Id: Icab5e28db63455358ab3919bd94c484411987e39

'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-07-02 23:03:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm confused.  Maybe I don't understand the usage model around oslo.  But I thought the idea was a common library that could be added as a dependency and used much like any other site-package.  If I put a static copy in the code base, it's no longer a common library and won't get updates and fixes.  What am I missing?"}, {'account_id': 4330, 'date': '2013-07-03 09:01:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

You're right.

Eventually, all of these pieces will be packaged and used just like any other library. But right now, they're in an incubation phase. Once they are stable enough and there is a consensus among the OpenStack projects to adopt a certain incubation library, it will be packaged properly.

Regarding updates and fixes, if you clone oslo-incubator next to horizon, you can run:

    cd oslo-incubator
    python update.py ../horizon

For more details:

https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator#the-oslo-incubator
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo#Incubation

For now, this is how all the other projects (Nova, Glance, Ceilometer, etc.) use the common RPC, DB, etc. code."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-10 12:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The explanation from Tomas is correct. At now, oslo is developed in one place and copied to OpenStack projects. Another important reason of using copy strategy at now is that each project needs to verify it repository works as expected with oslo library. Some version of oslo may not work with our code. We can avoid the situation by copying strategy and each project evolve independently.

I give +2 for this patch, but I would like to leave a chance to discuss/approve to David.'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-07-10 22:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Tomas.  Thanks for the explanation.  I just get worried when I see 8000 lines of duplicate code.  I am OK with the patch, but due to my slowness, the run_tests.sh env version needs to be bumped again.'}, {'account_id': 4330, 'date': '2013-07-11 07:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-11 08:11:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Add openstack-common

We're going to use openstack-common to receive notifications and then
pass them via socket.io to the client.

Prerequisite for blueprint realtime-communication

Change-Id: Ic590f52f14d000d07be6ee9a8da3df976b58c302
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Break up the swift pollsters

This change also adds a test dependency on testscenarios,
a library for reusing test class definitions for parameterized
tests.

blueprint one-meter-per-plugin

Change-Id: I0e1e0e4e225261598cc28d2e3335be6f163bbc85
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Break up compute pollsters

Break the compute pollsters up into separate plugins.  This is
submitted as one patch for all of the compute pollsters because
they are moved into a new package to make the files a little easier
to manage.

blueprint one-meter-per-plugin

Change-Id: Ibc6a9c3f73594c94b578f4229e1f9e9c941c7f4f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Relax upper capping for client to the next major version

Avoid capping, which makes gating not notice regressions
in certain cases. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-July/011660.html
for the discussion.

Fixes LP Bug #1200214

Change-Id: Ie23e9210e7517d220c8dd653d6e534cd161cf74a

commit_message:
Fix some issues in setup.py test

While tracking down a troveclient issue, found several issues in
the new python setup.py test command:

* check the right source files when we're trying to decide whether to
re-run egg_info
* fix bogus dependency links args when installing test requires
* fix bogus .egg_info dir name when a project name includes a hyphen

Change-Id: I0a1964902a87f72eb67f43b10f90dfee8c7d7875

commit_message:
Split migration config to separate file

This patch splits the migration configuration information into a separate file.

It also adds a paragraph about volume-backed live migration w/o shared storage,
a feature that was added in grizzly

Fix build.

patchset 3 rebases.

patchset 4 rebases

patchset 5 fixes xml syntax

fixes bug 1087050
bp:restructure-documentation

commit_message:
Support FlatDHCP network for VMware Hyper.

Auto create bridge when using FlatDHCP network, Add unittests for vif.

Fix bug #1171783
Fix bug #1177635

Change-Id: Ibb75c8e3174283f0f5e94bacfd61ee93e8bd6227
(cherry picked from commit bc66b8aa968a0c0b74e2f21ed0fc856f8933c6d3)

'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-06-17 14:22:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-17 17:28:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I don't understand where the fix is in this patch.  API samples are usually generated automatically... and it looks like the only change in this patch is that you've modified them manually.  It seems like if the automatically generated samples are wrong... then there's something wrong in the code that generates these samples.

The test that is added shouldn't cause any behavior change because it's effectively already inside a different test."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-17 21:01:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Chris.  I'm not sure what this is fixing, and it's definitely not being tested.  If namespaces aren't being checked for properly then I would guess that something in the verify_response() framework in test_api_samples needs reworking."}, {'account_id': 7490, 'date': '2013-06-18 04:01:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The bug is that when we try to create an instance with 'OS-DCF:diskConfig' flag set then server creation fails due to missing namespace declaration in the request.This scenario should be tested in DiskConfig extension,so that users will have a proper sample request to create server with disk_config flag."}, {'account_id': 7490, 'date': '2013-06-18 04:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Chris,
There is no fix in the patch because there is no bug as such.This bug was reproducible only because request was not made properly(namespace declaration was missing).Hence,this patch just enhances the sample request file.'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-18 13:26:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can you open a bug report for this issue with a sample request that's failing and the response from the API?"}, {'account_id': 7490, 'date': '2013-06-19 06:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I had already created it at https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1189817 .
I have added a comment there for ample request with a screenshot.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-20 13:00:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Sound like the issue is that api-sample is not really complete, as its missing the extra info?

Would be good to see this as an additional test though, but maybe I am miss understanding something here.

The bug this is fixing should be linked in the commit message. The bug you reference, however, doesn't appear to be a bug. If you send bad XML, you get a mal-formed request error, just as you would expecte"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-06-20 15:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If you put "bug 12345" in the commit message, we get a clickable link to go see what this is all about.'}, {'account_id': 7490, 'date': '2013-06-21 06:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-21 06:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-21 07:12:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/33002/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/29750 : SUCCESS in 3m 39s

(1 inline comment)

I still think this needs a test that will fail without your fix.  If it's important to have the namespace in the XML samples then samples should fail without it."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-07-04 10:16:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

'}, {'created': '2013-06-21 06:30:50.000000000', 'message': 'Changing the create server test for OS-DCF extension

The test did not have the os-dcf flag passed in.
Testing the server create with the os-dcf flag set.
Adding namespace in the xml request

Fixes OS-DCF:diskConfig=MANUAL using XML yields Bad Request

Fixes LP 1189817

Change-Id: I74969a5170ee032b07f8b97c784c599a981a634a
'}]
commit_message:
Changing the create server test for OS-DCF extension

The test did not have the os-dcf flag passed in.
Testing the server create with the os-dcf flag set.
Adding namespace in the xml request

Fixes OS-DCF:diskConfig=MANUAL using XML yields Bad Request

Fixes LP 1189817

Change-Id: I74969a5170ee032b07f8b97c784c599a981a634a

commit_message:
pyflakes update breaks flake8 and hacking

pyflakes got updated to 0.7.3 and that is causing
tox builds to fail with a version conflict. This
commit is relaxing the version constraints to
allow pyflakes 0.7.2 or greater (and pep8 1.4.5 or
greater).

ref: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyflakes/0.7.3

Fixes bug 1197675

Change-Id: I1adc1fd6fc1e814c908824086154b42dd542003a

commit_message:
avoid excessive database calls while loading events

list_events constructs Event objects through Event.load, which causes
every event record previously loaded into memory to be reloaded again.
Furthermore, Event.load will also reload the associated stack, thus
all its resources and template. Another bad thing with that is
reloading a stack will lead to many extra stack static resolution
(including calls to nova to resovle Fn::GetAZs if it's referenced in
the template).

Fixes bug #1195793

Change-Id: I4f14c9a2a4f990b753a6e1405e27eb44c53537c9

commit_message:
Add -U to the command line for pip

Since we have site-packages=True in nova, the existence of system
packages of the wrong version can cause nova to not install what
you expect into the tox virtualenv. Adding -U into the deps list
causes it to get appended into the command line, which causes pip
to do what we want and install what we asked for.

Change-Id: I4f388e07caf31ab870f22d261e856a205ebb36c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue with pip installing oslo.config-1.2.0

Fixes bug #1194807

Firstly, we update the oslo.config dep to 1.2.0a3 because of the issue
with namespace packages (bug #1194742).

But the main issue here is that if you currently do:

  $> pip install -r quantum/requirements.txt

then you end up with the oslo.config 1.1.1 code installed. This is
because oslo.config>=1.1.0 gets pulled in as a transitive dep and pip
gets confused. You can reproduce with e.g.

  $> pip install \
       http://.../oslo.config-1.2.0a3.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a3 \
       python-keystoneclient
  $> pip freeze | grep oslo.config
  oslo.config-1.2.0a3
  $> python -c 'from oslo.config.cfg import DeprecatedOpt'
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  ImportError: cannot import name DeprecatedOpt

This is because of a bug with pip where it sees oslo.config-1.2.0a3 and
oslo.config as two unrelated things. It should strip the version part of
the egg= fragment before using it as a package name, but it doesn't.

However, we can simply use the -f/--find-links pip option in our
requirements.txt to add the tarball URL to the list of URLs considered
and also add the oslo.config>=1.2.0a3 dependency:

  $> pip install \
       -f http://.../oslo.config-1.2.0a3.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a3 \
       'oslo.config>=1.2.0a3' \
       python-keystoneclient
  $> pip freeze | grep oslo.config
  oslo.config-1.2.0a3
  $> python -c 'from oslo.config.cfg import DeprecatedOpt'

This is actually exactly the semantics we want and we go to great
lengths in pbr to get these semantics while using a single tarball URL.
The only downside to this --find-links strategy is that we gain an extra
line in our requirements.txt ... but it does work around the pip bug.

Change-Id: I6f3eb5fd2c75615d9a1cae172aed859b36b27d4c

commit_message:
Fix issue with pip installing oslo.config-1.2.0

Fixes bug #1194807

Firstly, we update the oslo.config dep to 1.2.0a3 because of the issue
with namespace packages (bug #1194742).

But the main issue here is that if you currently do:

  $> pip install -r quantum/requirements.txt

then you end up with the oslo.config 1.1.1 code installed. This is
because oslo.config>=1.1.0 gets pulled in as a transitive dep and pip
gets confused. You can reproduce with e.g.

  $> pip install \
       http://.../oslo.config-1.2.0a3.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a3 \
       python-keystoneclient
  $> pip freeze | grep oslo.config
  oslo.config-1.2.0a3
  $> python -c 'from oslo.config.cfg import DeprecatedOpt'
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  ImportError: cannot import name DeprecatedOpt

This is because of a bug with pip where it sees oslo.config-1.2.0a3 and
oslo.config as two unrelated things. It should strip the version part of
the egg= fragment before using it as a package name, but it doesn't.

However, we can simply use the -f/--find-links pip option in our
requirements.txt to add the tarball URL to the list of URLs considered
and also add the oslo.config>=1.2.0a3 dependency:

  $> pip install \
       -f http://.../oslo.config-1.2.0a3.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a3 \
       'oslo.config>=1.2.0a3' \
       python-keystoneclient
  $> pip freeze | grep oslo.config
  oslo.config-1.2.0a3
  $> python -c 'from oslo.config.cfg import DeprecatedOpt'

This is actually exactly the semantics we want and we go to great
lengths in pbr to get these semantics while using a single tarball URL.
The only downside to this --find-links strategy is that we gain an extra
line in our requirements.txt ... but it does work around the pip bug.

Change-Id: I6f3eb5fd2c75615d9a1cae172aed859b36b27d4c

commit_message:
Put AUTHORS.in at the top of AUTHORS.

swift has an AUTHORS file that puts a header at the top of the
file with some extra information, then lists the contributors.
If we put AUTHORS.in at the top of the generated file, then we
can put their boilerplate into AUTHORS.in and the resulting file
should look the same.

Change-Id: I2caa4e606dd1199f49c925dccc64d492848ac580

commit_message:
Support version override with PBR prefix.

For non-OpenStack consumption of PBR, OSLO_PACKAGING_ is a weird
version override env var.

Change-Id: I8e80bcc5bc56e7950ed5cf0d24657957570134cf

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 18:24:12.000000000', 'message': 'Quiet down a large log file heavy hitter.

This line of code serialized the python structure for the device and throws it
at the log file.  The string is about 90K characters, isn't very useful and we
found that it takes a very large amount of space in the log file causing them
to grow very quickly and fill our log disk.  This change extracts the device
name (e.g.  "tapcdc07af9-8a") and uses that in the log message.

Change-Id: I240eb811445752407583f0fb322ce061acb293b9
Fixes: Bug #1200321
'}]
commit_message:
Quiet down a large log file heavy hitter.

This line of code serialized the python structure for the device and throws it
at the log file.  The string is about 90K characters, isn't very useful and we
found that it takes a very large amount of space in the log file causing them
to grow very quickly and fill our log disk.  This change extracts the device
name (e.g.  "tapcdc07af9-8a") and uses that in the log message.

Change-Id: I240eb811445752407583f0fb322ce061acb293b9
Fixes: Bug #1200321

Distro packagers don't really need for us to attempt to pip install
things for them. They're usually managing that dependency tree
in the distro packaging. Add an env var they can set in their spec
or rules files to skip any pretense of doing anything with install
requirements.

Change-Id: Ia6387eab3267fa3c4019c4a9d90e4780319c2397
"}, {'created': '2013-07-11 20:42:45.000000000', 'message': "Allow pip installation to be skipped.

Distro packagers don't really need for us to attempt to pip install
things for them. They're usually managing that dependency tree
in the distro packaging. Add an env var they can set in their spec
or rules files to skip any pretense of doing anything with install
requirements.

Change-Id: Ia6387eab3267fa3c4019c4a9d90e4780319c2397
"}]
commit_message:
Allow pip installation to be skipped.

Distro packagers don't really need for us to attempt to pip install
things for them. They're usually managing that dependency tree
in the distro packaging. Add an env var they can set in their spec
or rules files to skip any pretense of doing anything with install
requirements.

Change-Id: Ia6387eab3267fa3c4019c4a9d90e4780319c2397

commit_message:
Don't run pip needlessly

We can detect if the env we are a part of has our requirements met
already. If this is the case, don't re-run pip at all, so that we
don't waste time.

Change-Id: If49cd7bd558f98d8e6f51b0fe0192978bee9c77e

commit_message:
Do not override FnGetAtt

FnGetAtt is handled by the parent classes so no need to override

contributes to blueprint provider-resource

Change-Id: I3cb1bfc353fedf33336151f3ebc4d283330336a0

commit_message:
Add default QPID_HOST

Change 056df827ff3f8d40eeeedea3d09daae86982e5b5 added QPID_HOST
without a default.  This leaves a blank config line which confuses the
heck out of just about every daemon

Change-Id: Ibc4b5e5349fd6347d0100431f9347f1eff4aaf83

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 17:41:23.000000000', 'message': "Cinder installation cleanup

 * Make a clear dinstinction between yum and deb commands/configs.
 * Adapt the RabbitMQ configuration to what's been used in the previous
   sections.
 * Use /etc/tgt/targets.conf as tgt config file. It is more generic and
   available on all supported distributions.
 * Rework the markup to make the source and the output a bit clearer (I
   hope).

Change-Id: Ie66c88b9c804d10600b26f6ffa478083fa55d1f6
Fixes: bug #1199951
"}]
commit_message:
Cinder installation cleanup

 * Make a clear dinstinction between yum and deb commands/configs.
 * Adapt the RabbitMQ configuration to what's been used in the previous
   sections.
 * Use /etc/tgt/targets.conf as tgt config file. It is more generic and
   available on all supported distributions.
 * Rework the markup to make the source and the output a bit clearer (I
   hope).

Change-Id: Ie66c88b9c804d10600b26f6ffa478083fa55d1f6
Fixes: bug #1199951

Replaced all instances of 'nicira_nvp_plugin' in module and
configuration paths with ''. That is to say instances of
quantum.plugins.nicira.nicira_nvp_plugin became quantum.plugins.nicira.
Instances of quantum/plugins/nicira/nicira_nvp_plugin became
quantum/plugins/nicira. Instances where it appears the update has
already been made have been left as is.

Change-Id: I272ae1f01a7654ec37b1051c8169eb0ef60aa987
"}]
commit_message:
Bug # 1166307 - Updated Nicira NVP Plugin Paths

Replaced all instances of 'nicira_nvp_plugin' in module and
configuration paths with ''. That is to say instances of
quantum.plugins.nicira.nicira_nvp_plugin became quantum.plugins.nicira.
Instances of quantum/plugins/nicira/nicira_nvp_plugin became
quantum/plugins/nicira. Instances where it appears the update has
already been made have been left as is.

Change-Id: I272ae1f01a7654ec37b1051c8169eb0ef60aa987

commit_message:
Clean up hacking and path issues with d2to1

We imported in another code base. It takes a little bit of path
adjusting to get things right.

Change-Id: Ifb96652c822d5d243a6bedb77bc34e919be2d3a8

commit_message:
Put AUTHORS.in at the top of AUTHORS.

swift has an AUTHORS file that puts a header at the top of the
file with some extra information, then lists the contributors.
If we put AUTHORS.in at the top of the generated file, then we
can put their boilerplate into AUTHORS.in and the resulting file
should look the same.

Change-Id: I2caa4e606dd1199f49c925dccc64d492848ac580

commit_message:
Allow pip installation to be skipped.

Distro packagers don't really need for us to attempt to pip install
things for them. They're usually managing that dependency tree
in the distro packaging. Add an env var they can set in their spec
or rules files to skip any pretense of doing anything with install
requirements.

Change-Id: Ia6387eab3267fa3c4019c4a9d90e4780319c2397

commit_message:
Add service groups config section

As noted in the bug report, we weren;t mentioning Zookeeper

This takes the writeup from
https://github.com/maoy/writeups/blob/master/ZooKeeperInNova.md
formats it in docbook, makes it a bit less dev-centric and formats it
so that future service group drivers can be added.

fixes bug 1106449

Patchset fixes missing xml:ids from new sections.

Change-Id: I7ec1a422e85a79489474e936c3a28816e74b30db

[{'created': '2013-06-30 05:56:49.000000000', 'message': 'hanges swift xfs inode advice to be more modern

In past couple of years, the XFS team has greatly improved inode use in
xfs. With more recent kernels, there is no performance penalty for
using the default inode size, and a smaller inode size gives us
improvements in other areas where disk access is involved.

fixes bug 1196768

Change-Id: Ib5903bffc6e113155b40d5df63919f4ca5c6ed73
'}]
commit_message:
hanges swift xfs inode advice to be more modern

In past couple of years, the XFS team has greatly improved inode use in
xfs. With more recent kernels, there is no performance penalty for
using the default inode size, and a smaller inode size gives us
improvements in other areas where disk access is involved.

fixes bug 1196768

Change-Id: Ib5903bffc6e113155b40d5df63919f4ca5c6ed73

commit_message:
Don't run pip needlessly

We can detect if the env we are a part of has our requirements met
already. If this is the case, don't re-run pip at all, so that we
don't waste time.

Change-Id: If49cd7bd558f98d8e6f51b0fe0192978bee9c77e

commit_message:
Remove Costs from the 'Weights and Costs' Chapter

Costs are no longer used in the scheduler, so Weights chapter is
updated with the remaining ram_weight_multiplier option.

Fixes bug 1172264

Change-Id: Ic8c57b2107c1e334acb1adfe3498d33fde7b435d

commit_message:
Mark diablo, essex and folsom with their status

This patch marks the landing pages of non-maintained releases
with appropriate information.

patchset2 addresses Anne's comments
patchset4 - diane fleming - made editorial changes

fixes bug 1191447

Change-Id: Ia90d86a3328ec293e654886d3417d2d846cb8430

There's no reason to try and maintain them until there's a problem to solve.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-07-11 14:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-07-11 15:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

An upper cap on the next major version is a "theoretical" limitation anyway, since the intent is that we never do incompatible changes, with other words there is no need for a major version bump. 

However, *if* it happens,then fixing all modules and all maintained stable/ branches in *one* go to unbreak gating is hardly possible. I'd therefore prefer to have the upper limitation on the *major* version only. 

There is "maintenance" involved with those upper caps anyway, as they're not planned to be reached at any time.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-11 16:02:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The in development 3.0.0 Neutron client will be backwards incompatible.  That is why we were the first to propose a version cap."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-11 17:46:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

that means that neutronclient can't be tested in the gate, which seems terrible. I think we really need to rethink that approach."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-11 20:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-11 20:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

per mailing list thread, allowing any project to cap one of our
own clients actually prevents us from testing that client's git

to creep into the clients because they are no longer tested in

We need to start with uncapping the global list, then ensuring

version in devstack gate (because there are 2 ways to install a
python client, one from git, one from pip). This can allow bugs

commit_message:
remove python-fooclient version caps

per mailing list thread, allowing any project to cap one of our
own clients actually prevents us from testing that client's git
version in devstack gate (because there are 2 ways to install a
python client, one from git, one from pip). This can allow bugs
to creep into the clients because they are no longer tested in
the gate.

We need to start with uncapping the global list, then ensuring
we uncap this in all the projects.

Neutron client excluded because of a need for incompatible
changes in v3.

Needed to make progress on bug #1200214

Change-Id: Ice57c9bd9ce2bbd786ca0c80a1b94049a7f63ff8

commit_message:
Sync v2/v3 servers.py API files

Syncs changes to the V2 API files for the compute_api returning
instance objects in commit 2a781f48c220353b82b748796998b2f5a12c4ad4
to the V3 API files. Also syncing some changes required to the V3
unittests

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: If9dfbef60e59cf22ecc6269522622e733ef12dd1

commit_message:
Add functionality to rebuild a server.

Rebuild -- shut down and then re-image.

Change-Id: Ibb0a2e3b244fa318576d23e2b79106309ddec950
Implements: blueprint rebuild-server

We did nova first in the pbr transition, so it didn't get the pin
we added to everyone else later on.

Change-Id: I04c3e810f49a1e4388496ff5226cf094c787d1a9
"}, {'created': '2013-07-10 17:57:38.000000000', 'message': "Properly pin pbr and d2to1 in setup.py

We did nova first in the pbr transition, so it didn't get the pin
we added to everyone else later on.

Fixes bug 1199923

Change-Id: I04c3e810f49a1e4388496ff5226cf094c787d1a9
"}]
commit_message:
Properly pin pbr and d2to1 in setup.py

We did nova first in the pbr transition, so it didn't get the pin
we added to everyone else later on.

Fixes bug 1199923

Change-Id: I04c3e810f49a1e4388496ff5226cf094c787d1a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-24 16:16:58.000000000', 'message': 'Pin kombu and anyjson versions

The minimum version of kombu in the requirements
list has been updated to ensure that compatible
kombu and msgpack libraries are used across all
projects. That update also requires an update
to anyjson.

Addresses bug #1134575

Change-Id: I1520af1315fe649f52ab62769164dc67f4396651
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Pin kombu and anyjson versions

The minimum version of kombu in the requirements
list has been updated to ensure that compatible
kombu and msgpack libraries are used across all
projects. That update also requires an update
to anyjson.

Addresses bug #1134575

Change-Id: I1520af1315fe649f52ab62769164dc67f4396651
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

[{'created': '2013-07-11 07:21:10.000000000', 'message': 'Check enabled backup service before rpc request

In previous code we didn't check whether we have an enabled
backup service there before we send out the rpc request,
results that if no enabled backup service there,the volume will
stays in "backing-up" state and the backup will stays in "creating".
What's more, start cinder-backup all started backups will be set
to 'error'

This patch fixed this issue, we exam whether at least an enabled
backup service available before we do the rpc request.

Fixes: bug #1200040
Change-Id: I77154528f489ed20f7b784e6fcefccf15dc81d1d

commit_message:
Check enabled backup service before rpc request

In previous code we didn't check whether we have an enabled
backup service there before we send out the rpc request,
results that if no enabled backup service there,the volume will
stays in "backing-up" state and the backup will stays in "creating".

This patch fixed this issue, we exam whether at least an appropriate
(same host,az as the volume and is_alive) backup service available
before we do the rpc request.

Fixes: bug #1200040
Change-Id: I77154528f489ed20f7b784e6fcefccf15dc81d1d

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

I would like to consider a different way for resetting list attributes.
The natural way of doing it for me would be specifying something like:
dns_nameservers=null

It seeems instead we have to specify dns_nameservers list=true, without any value.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I think the change in the way value_specs are handled would make the cli backward incompatible

If I had a script that did:

quantum net-update id --admin_state_up 

Whose aim was to bring the state up, now that script won't work anymore as it would setting the attribute to None

I also don't think natural at all that for clearing an attribute you have to specify it without a value.

Anyway, Yong is the person in charge of the CLI. If he feels that there's no backward compatibility issues, and if the devised solution for clearing an attribute is deemed ok, I am happy with it."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'quantum subnet-udpate subnets --dns_nameservers'
will put the dns_nameservers to null."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Yes, It has problem with back compatibility.
But do we want to use quantum --dns_nameservers list=true None as the method?

I thought it is ok with '--dns_nameservers list=true|type=list None'
but what if it is a string argument? for example '--name None'. Should we treat the name to have 'None' string value or just clear the name attr?

How about introducing an action option? For example: '--dns_nameservers action=clear' '--name action=clear'."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Hi,
One minor inline nit.
I think that the new API can be a bit confusing and we should try and resolve the issues. Here are a few examples that the value None is invalid (and they require different values for example '' and []:

openstack@ubuntu-devstack:~$ quantum port-update f2add2fd-5b89-43cb-8819-76750708c953 --name action=clear
Invalid input for name. Reason: 'None' is not a valid string.
openstack@ubuntu-devstack:~$ quantum port-update f2add2fd-5b89-43cb-8819-76750708c953 --fixed_ips action=clear
Invalid input for fixed_ips. Reason: 'None' is not a valid fixed IP.

Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Happy to approve once the comments have been addressed.
BTW, this is the longest living patch on openstack gerrit!'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

The newly proposed approach is kind of valuable. It reminds me for instance of the xe cli, where you 'clear' a parameter by doing xe <resource>-param-clear <param_name>.

On your comment on patch set 1, I probably did not say that all I wanted to do was to clear every parameter just as we do for gateway_ip on the subnet resource, which apparently is the only 'clearable' one that we have. That parameter allows for JSON null to be sent to the server, and that is treated appropriately. At the CLI level I think it is safely reasonable assumption to say that 'null' should also be interpreted as JSON null and not as a string.

Keeping that in mind action=clear is reasonably good for me; but I would like to wait for input from other people.

On Gary's comment, I agree this is a separate issue of the Quantum API which does not address yet nullable attributes."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

it feels like we've reached an impasse :)"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The other (viable) approach would be to forbid value 'None' for String variables. I think that's the reason why action=clear was proposed in the first place. Frankly I am okay with that too, I find it hard to believe that one would name a port 'None', but you'll never know..."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

small nits inline. I like the approach of unsetting an attribute with action=clear.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

action=clear feels very disjoint from the rest of how the CLI work and I'm not sure is very intuitive for the most users."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

garyk:
about if the none value is accepted, we can file a bug on server side to let the server accepts it if the value is ok.
Most of time, we will use convert function on some attr that can be cleared.

Yong Sheng Gong'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Salvatore Orlando,
your *persistent support encourages me to continue this patch.
:)'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (3 inline comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'message': 'Allow user to specify None value to attributes

Bug #1086232

Change-Id: Ia8dffcfd1122259d545a61e71db25e459639d130
'}, {'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'message': 'Allow user to specify None value to attributes

Bug #1086232

We introduce the action=clear to unkown agument part of
the command line. With this option, user can specify which
attribut will have None value.

For example to set dns_nameservers of subnet to None, we use:
quantum subnet-update subnetname --dns_nameservers action=clear

Of course, client command developer can use known option like --no-gateway
to do the same job.
Change-Id: Ia8dffcfd1122259d545a61e71db25e459639d130
'}, {'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'message': 'Allow user to specify None value to attributes

Bug #1086232

We introduce the action=clear to unkown agument part of
the command line. With this option, user can specify which
attribut will have None value.

For example to set dns_nameservers of subnet to None, we use:
quantum subnet-update subnetname --dns_nameservers action=clear

commit_message:
Allow user to specify None value to attributes

Bug #1086232

We introduce the action=clear to unknown argument part of
the command line. With this option, user can specify which
attribute will have None value.

For example to set dns_nameservers of subnet to None, we use:
quantum subnet-update subnetname --dns_nameservers action=clear

Of course, client command developer can use known option like --no-gateway
to do the same job.

Change-Id: Ia8dffcfd1122259d545a61e71db25e459639d130

commit_message:
Fix some issues in setup.py test.

While tracking down a troveclient issue, found several issues in
the new python setup.py test command:

* check the right source files when we're trying to decide whether to
re-run egg_info
* fix bogus dependency links args when installing test requires
* fix bogus .egg_info dir name when a project name includes a hyphen

Change-Id: I0a1964902a87f72eb67f43b10f90dfee8c7d7875

subject: Support version override with PBR prefix.

commit_message:
Support version override with PBR prefix.

For non-OpenStack consumption of PBR, OSLO_PACKAGING_ is a weird
version override env var.

Change-Id: I8e80bcc5bc56e7950ed5cf0d24657957570134cf

'}, {'created': '2013-07-11 05:56:00.000000000', 'message': 'Better compute_api.reboot handling for cells

commit_message:
Better compute_api.reboot handling for cells

This adds a separate cell RPCAPI call for reboot_instance which is
compatible with the compute_rpcapi version and ditches the special
cells API version of reboot().

Change-Id: I99dda59fb53857bf6d518f073e30d3203e2c0235

commit_message:
Prep Instance.save() for cells

Instance.save() needs to support expected_vm_state when saving changes
as we'll need this when converting cells to use objects.

It also needs to understand whether or not any task_state/vm_state
changes are coming from a forced-reset.  Normally we do not want to
update child cells' view of vm_state and task_state, but forced-resets
should be sent down.  Use of this will come in a follow-up patch.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: Iab2ed643811f8a638a44f52184ed3a1766354bd4

commit_message:
Convert kombu SSL version string into integer

When specifying 'kombu_ssl_version' for the RPC driver such as either
"kombu_ssl_version=3" or "kombu_ssl_version=SSLv3" the relevant
OpenStack service (nova, cinder, etc) will fail as the underlying
rpc driver is trying to create an SSL socket which requires an
integer such as the following built-in SSL integer constants. Added
a validation step that ensures one can set only the supported ssl
versions and to convert from the specified string to an integer

Fixes LP# 1195431

Change-Id: I5d188f46a15bc4ba60d573d6b98def60c56cb987

commit_message:
Edit-Spellcheck Review. Corrected:
--'service' vs 'project' errors (using 'code').
--'compute' service -> 'Compute' errors.
--Wording around Havana release.
--'should' to 'must', where appropriate.

Change-Id: Ie3a9775afffac5646d643155ecad0ab1d2326d2e

commit_message:
Sync openstack-requirements.

Syncs latest requirements.txt + test-requirements.txt from
openstack-requirements.  Specifically, this is meant to
bump the maximum python-keystoneclient version requirement
to <= 0.4.

Change-Id: Ic07e70087b26dbafc20ae3ab947556a32968d1dd

'}, {'created': '2013-07-11 10:06:06.000000000', 'message': 'Be compatible with oslo.config 1.2.0a3+

commit_message:
Be compatible with oslo.config 1.2.0a3+

The private API of oslo.config changed, and the Cisco
options parsing code was using it.
Use an explicit MultiConfigParser instance for parsing
the config files.

Fixes LP Bug #1196084

Change-Id: I7ffcac3c295491fe9ba8abc7e98f33157a48c51b

commit_message:
Move temporary test files into tests/tmp

Add a new folder tests/tmp and move all temporary test artefacts like
sqlite dbs into the folder. This has a number of advantages:

- clean up .gitignore and tests folder.
- common/sql/util.py files didn't really belong in common as they were
  test only.
- by doing ``sudo mount -t tmpfs -o size=16M tmpfs tests/tmp; sudo chown
  $USER: tests/tmp`` tests speed up about 3x (ext4; credit ayoung's blog).

Change-Id: I9b02a5273dd27db963e9a26085b7456f4c5f6a41

[{'created': '2013-07-11 04:12:25.000000000', 'message': "Global disable scheduler _sleep instead of mocking.

It is becoming increasingly difficult to predict when
a call to TaskRunner._sleep needs to be scripted, and is probably an
implementation detail which shouldn't be exposed to unit tests anyway.

This change defines a global which prevents sleeping in calls to _sleep
and toggles that global in HeatTestCase setUp.

Change-Id: I98dc88c9d120c409d5720895bb4fb625a1f12991
"}]
commit_message:
Global disable scheduler _sleep instead of mocking.

It is becoming increasingly difficult to predict when
a call to TaskRunner._sleep needs to be scripted, and is probably an
implementation detail which shouldn't be exposed to unit tests anyway.

This change defines a global which prevents sleeping in calls to _sleep
and toggles that global in HeatTestCase setUp.

Change-Id: I98dc88c9d120c409d5720895bb4fb625a1f12991

commit_message:
Add _set_instance_obj_error_state() to compute manager

This provides an object-aware analog to the existing function,
which operates on an object instead of using a uuid and the
conductor instance update path.

Over time, we should be able to transition all existing uses to
this function, and then remove the old implementation.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I781eadfb01a13bab9337ec05653a4780447731b8

subject: Update v3 servers API with objects changes

commit_message:
Update v3 servers API with objects changes

This simply synchronizes the v3 servers API and tests with all the
changes made to v2 in the preceeding patches.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I39b3a6f908bcb4b013d014ad4e7fbfbc40e25a55

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 21:36:23.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure periodic instance reclaims continues on error

If an instance reclaim operation fails with an exception, no more
instances will be reclaimed. If the failure is permanent, this will
block other instances from being reclaimed for as long as it remains.

Resolves bug 1195029.

Change-Id: I0379d16a1f74344ef44c843ce19a505e31e79bfa
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure periodic instance reclaims continues on error

If an instance reclaim operation fails with an exception, no more
instances will be reclaimed. If the failure is permanent, this will
block other instances from being reclaimed for as long as it remains.

Resolves bug 1195029.

Change-Id: I0379d16a1f74344ef44c843ce19a505e31e79bfa

volumes. We don't currently refer to policy.json outside
this example, so the fix is just to update the example

fixes bug 1111099

Change-Id: I6a64959da4308faa57b4b6985b91eacaf6d9dc09

commit_message:
Update policy.json example for grizzly vol changes

As noted in the bug report, new extension was added for
volumes. We don't currently refer to policy.json outside
this example, so the fix is just to update the example
with the new lines.

fixes bug 1111099

Change-Id: I6a64959da4308faa57b4b6985b91eacaf6d9dc09

The seed node config had a host specified rather than a network for
MASQUERADE. Anyone following devtest would have had no outbound
connectivity from booted nodes (except to 192.168.122.1).

Change-Id: I37d335bc6c1316e38f8e1119899245dd491a4098

commit_message:
Fix seed MASQUERADE rules.

The seed node config had a host specified rather than a network for
MASQUERADE. Anyone following devtest would have had no outbound
connectivity from booted nodes (except to 192.168.122.1).

Change-Id: I37d335bc6c1316e38f8e1119899245dd491a4098

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 22:44:33.000000000', 'message': 'Update cached metadata with heat-localip.

Previously we only updated the cfn-init-data that was written to disk on
first boot. However, cfn-hup will be writing to the cached last_metadata
file, which is what os-apply-config will read if it exists.

Change-Id: I48800908d67a96c1bca588972db7838264eaace2
'}]
commit_message:
Update cached metadata with heat-localip.

Previously we only updated the cfn-init-data that was written to disk on
first boot. However, cfn-hup will be writing to the cached last_metadata
file, which is what os-apply-config will read if it exists.

Change-Id: I48800908d67a96c1bca588972db7838264eaace2

commit_message:
Update resource manager for fixed stevedore issue

Stevedore commit 69e17801a3f0cf37257069da7dc83e2608f31aa5 fixed a
known issue in conductor.resource_manager.

This patch updates the Ironic code to use stevedore's new accessor.

Change-Id: I0f57831a70368afb5ea321c0e607f762d464c2a0

I thought search would return an empty array.  Apparently it it
is not, and not a bad thing to make sure that it always does.

Change-Id: Ia39a092ffae69f94619ac9c640c1ffcc4d70510f

commit_message:
Should always return an array

I thought search would return an empty array.  Apparently it it
is not, and not a bad thing to make sure that it always does.
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/40125/

Change-Id: Ia39a092ffae69f94619ac9c640c1ffcc4d70510f

That doesn't help existing database installs though. In Nova we also required adding another migration to migrate existing tables to innodb when we did this."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-06-14 20:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

- http://logs.openstack.org/33102/3/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/10485 : FAILURE in 35m 18s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-16 11:41:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

so I would just leave migration 27, and not change any of the prior migrations, because otherwise you won't know if migration 27 actually fixes the issue, or the ones before it.

On empty tables the engine change is pretty cheap, so doing it in 27 isn't a big deal. If you ever do a migration collapse like nova has done then fix it up there."}, {'account_id': 91, 'date': '2013-06-17 09:10:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

What is the purpose of changing the engine in all of the individual migrations? In an existing deployment, only the 27 would be actually applied."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-06-17 16:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-17 16:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-06-17 16:10:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sean Dague / Alvaro Lopez Garcia -

The prior migrations are needed so that tables in new installs are created correctly when the system default is MyISAM. Without those changes, the tables don't get foreign key constraints.

Also, for existing deployments, we don't know what version they're starting at so more than just 27 could be applied.

The only change made in the latest version is to fix the pep8 issue."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-17 17:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/33102/4/check/gate-keystone-pep8/5751 : SUCCESS in 2m 23s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33102/4/check/gate-keystone-docs/4124/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 18s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33102/4/check/gate-keystone-python26/4644 : SUCCESS in 14m 06s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33102/4/check/gate-keystone-python27/4657 : SUCCESS in 8m 07s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33102/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/23917 : SUCCESS in 44m 45s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33102/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/23623 : SUCCESS in 54m 10s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33102/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/31341 : SUCCESS in 23m 31s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33102/4/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/10858 : FAILURE in 39m 32s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6460, 'date': '2013-06-17 17:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

looks good'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-17 20:42:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Brant, then you should have migration 27 add those FK back in case they didn't get created earlier.

Changing migrations in the past is madness, and just leads to having people who think they are on the same version of the db, not be.

Make migration 27 a "get everyone to sanity, reintroduce the foreign keys, and away you go." Then from 27 forward you know that everyone that got to 27, no matter how they got there, has the same schema. By backdating migrations you just cause more inconsistencies for existing installs, not less.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-06-17 22:23:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress

commit_message:
Use InnoDB for MySQL

This change adds a migration to convert any non-InnoDB tables to
InnoDB.

On some systems, the default engine is MyISAM, which doesn't
support features used by Keystone (foreign keys).

The approach is the same as what's used in Nova. A test is added
to ensure that all tables use InnoDB after migration. The test
passes when all the tables are mysql_engine='InnoDB'. This is
accomplished by adding a new migration that migrates all the
tables that aren't InnoDB to InnoDB.

Fixes bug 1191110.

Change-Id: I220f7642f5468c5cf4194f248210f90ff983b6e5

commit_message:
Revert "Sync latest rpc changes from oslo-incubator"

Fixes bug #1200069

Looks like there's a serious issue with the kombu heartbeat implementation.

This reverts commit 386a8c21ec6acbaa059eabd166dbf7feea2fad7d

Change-Id: I354f5e3c5af110542a3c25d117b14e7be02f169b

Without this, changes in parameters specified in the update
will not propagate to resources.

Fixes bug: #1199189
Change-Id: Ic19b907e9dd12c121757cb7c6b3d0342415d0482

commit_message:
Use new environment and parameters on stack update.

Without this, changes in parameters specified in the update
will not propagate to resources.

Fixes bug: #1199189
Change-Id: Ic19b907e9dd12c121757cb7c6b3d0342415d0482

commit_message:
Handle conversion of MAP properties to JSON params

Since JsonParameter takes either a string or a Mapping, just pass the property
value directly as is done with strings and numbers

contributes to blueprint provider-resource

Change-Id: I71d5c0d9e3fcf3ffea9a89d2c37888faec35cd4a

commit_message:
Add unique constraint to ConsolePool.

Added unique constraint to ConsolePool model
`uniq_console_pools0host0console_type0compute_host0deleted` ('host',
'console_type', 'compute_host', 'deleted').
Added new exception `ConsolePoolExists`. Function `console_pool_create`
updated. Tests updated respectively.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys
Fixes bug 1185450

Change-Id: I095a52f2d21ec48b079e61034d80bcb9e7fcab79

commit_message:
Added nfs client packages

Since grizzly introduced cinder nfs support, compute nodes will need
nfs client packages to mount nfs shares for cinder.

Change-Id: Id469c3dc480b81438cef8c23b5344fd5a7dd7f7b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 21:35:18.000000000', 'message': 'Enable setting blocksize on volumes.

Currently libvirt assumes volumes to have
a block size of 512 when attaching to an instance.

Some back-ends however support other blocksizes (like 4096),
this change adds a provider_geometry column to the volumes table,
format is "physical_block_size=nnn,logical_block_size=nnn".

This can then be used by nova virt to determine if it should pass in
non-default block_size info, and there's a method for future
geometry/disk info that might be needed.

Fixes bug: 1196248

 Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting

Change-Id: I8d40bc56403154fbe955cd4ccf8f0c55fc9eb7c5

commit_message:
Enable setting blocksize on volumes.

Some back-ends support blocksizes other than the default 512 (like 4096),
this change adds a provider_geometry column to the volumes table,
format is "physical_block_size logical_block_size".

This can then be used by libvirt to determine if it should pass in
non-default block_size info, and there's a method for future
geometry/disk info that might be needed.

Fixes bug: 1196248

Change-Id: I8d40bc56403154fbe955cd4ccf8f0c55fc9eb7c5

commit_message:
Adding support for netapp NFS direct driver

This commit adds support for the 7mode NFS direct driver.
Changed the 'if driver' to a case, somewhat based off the
rcbops cinder-volume recipe. if the NFS driver is chosen, the
volume recipe will install the nfs client package, setup a mountpoint
a shares config file, and setups cinder.conf accordingly

Change-Id: Ia8d4c31235426614a317729494569062a23a05bf

subject: Added Generic Persistence API and Datatypes
messages:
[{'account_id': 7839, 'date': '2013-07-02 17:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-07-02 18:10:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (48 inline comments)

Overall looking good.

- Use context managers when u can to avoid lock releasing not happening.

What do u think about putting all of these under say a new folder?

taskflow/details/flow.py
taskflow/details/task.py
taskflow/details/blahblah.py

Task details seems to be turning out nicely.

I wonder if we can join the concept in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34846/4/taskflow/utils.py (runner class) with the task details class and they can be happily married.

That class wraps a task with 'detail' information, and allows for said wrapper to call() into the underlying task when activated, as well as connecting said class to other runners that provide needed inputs for the task to run. I like this kind of wrapper better than having to shove alot of similar information into the task class/object itself (like uuid) since I would want to be able to associate the same task twice with a flow and be able to have that work (the same task, but two different runner/taskdetail wrappers)."}, {'account_id': 7839, 'date': '2013-07-02 18:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (21 inline comments)

Responded to some comments.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-07-02 19:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (10 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7839, 'date': '2013-07-02 19:45:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7839, 'date': '2013-07-11 21:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Added Generic Persistence API and Datatypes

Added a generic persistence API for JobBoards,
Jobs, LogBooks, Workflows, FlowDetails, Tasks,
and TaskDetails. The currently implemented
backends are in-memory and sqlite db (by use
of sqlalchemy). Also implemented generic return
types (listed above) for the generic API.

Change-Id: I05377d09b69ae1acd1f3d7e40ebee01e01c4c432

[{'created': '2013-07-10 23:59:36.000000000', 'message': 'Validate dscp value less that 64

Previously neutron would raise a 500 error if the dscp value was greater
than 63. This patch adds validation to neutron so that a clear error
message is returned if the value is greater than 63.

Fixes bug 1200026

Change-Id: I41a93661952669d112463608be907eede1901490
'}]
commit_message:
Validate dscp value less that 64

Previously neutron would raise a 500 error if the dscp value was greater
than 63. This patch adds validation to neutron so that a clear error
message is returned if the value is greater than 63.

Fixes bug 1200026

Change-Id: I41a93661952669d112463608be907eede1901490

commit_message:
Add a role for os-infra-caching

openstack-common searches for role infra-caching.  Adding the role
os-infra-cachine (to be consistent with the current naming schema).
I will update openstack-common in a moment.

Change-Id: If5a452ea93727c20c57a62e59ac8bd4c4bcff885

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-03 13:59:20.000000000', 'message': 'RPC: Add support for optional message signing

Wires in SecureMessage so that signing can be optionally used.
Signing messages is always attempted but failing to create a signed message is
currently not fatal. In case of failure the message is sent unsigned.

Once all services has been converted to support signing, we can start switching
on mandatory signing.

commit_message:
RPC: Add support for optional message signing

Wires in SecureMessage so that signing can be optionally used.
Signing messages is always attempted but failing to create a signed message is
currently not fatal. In case of failure the message is sent unsigned.

Once all services has been converted to support signing, we can start switching
on mandatory signing.

Currently the service name needs to be a global due to the way services are
constructed.

Change-Id: I4aa81a1581a6e067a90da6309cab45c6a1d6cfc0
Implements: blueprint trusted-messaging

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-02 12:04:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue with pip installing oslo.config-1.2.0

Fixes bug #1194807

Firstly, we update the oslo.config dep to 1.2.0a3 because of the issue
with namespace packages (bug #1194742).

But the main issue here is that if we ever added a dependency to our
requirements.txt that had a dependency on an older version of
oslo.config we would see the same issue thatt Nova and Quantum recently
experienced where you end up with the oslo.config 1.1.1 code installed.
This is because oslo.config>=1.1.0 gets pulled in as a transitive dep
and pip gets confused. You can reproduce with e.g.

  $> pip install \
       http://.../oslo.config-1.2.0a3.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a3 \
       python-keystoneclient
  $> pip freeze | grep oslo.config
  oslo.config-1.2.0a3
  $> python -c 'from oslo.config.cfg import DeprecatedOpt'
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  ImportError: cannot import name DeprecatedOpt

This is because of a bug with pip where it sees oslo.config-1.2.0a3 and
oslo.config as two unrelated things. It should strip the version part of
the egg= fragment before using it as a package name, but it doesn't.

However, we can simply use the -f/--find-links pip option in our
requirements.txt to add the tarball URL to the list of URLs considered
and also add the oslo.config>=1.2.0a3 dependency:

  $> pip install \
       -f http://.../oslo.config-1.2.0a3.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a3 \
       'oslo.config>=1.2.0a3' \
       python-keystoneclient
  $> pip freeze | grep oslo.config
  oslo.config-1.2.0a3
  $> python -c 'from oslo.config.cfg import DeprecatedOpt'

This is actually exactly the semantics we want and we go to great
lengths in pbr to get these semantics while using a single tarball URL.
The only downside to this --find-links strategy is that we gain an extra
line in our requirements.txt ... but it does work around the pip bug.

Change-Id: I6f3eb5fd2c75615d9a1cae172aed859b36b27d4c
'}, {'created': '2013-07-10 21:29:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue with pip installing oslo.config-1.2.0

commit_message:
Fix issue with pip installing oslo.config-1.2.0

Fixes bug #1194807

Firstly, we update the oslo.config dep to 1.2.0a3 because of the issue
with namespace packages (bug #1194742).

But the main issue here is that if we ever added a dependency to our
requirements.txt that had a dependency on an older version of
oslo.config we would see the same issue thatt Nova and Quantum recently
experienced where you end up with the oslo.config 1.1.1 code installed.
This is because oslo.config>=1.1.0 gets pulled in as a transitive dep
and pip gets confused. You can reproduce with e.g.

  $> pip install \
       http://.../oslo.config-1.2.0a3.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a3 \
       python-keystoneclient
  $> pip freeze | grep oslo.config
  oslo.config-1.2.0a3
  $> python -c 'from oslo.config.cfg import DeprecatedOpt'
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  ImportError: cannot import name DeprecatedOpt

This is because of a bug with pip where it sees oslo.config-1.2.0a3 and
oslo.config as two unrelated things. It should strip the version part of
the egg= fragment before using it as a package name, but it doesn't.

However, we can simply use the -f/--find-links pip option in our
requirements.txt to add the tarball URL to the list of URLs considered
and also add the oslo.config>=1.2.0a3 dependency:

  $> pip install \
       -f http://.../oslo.config-1.2.0a3.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a3 \
       'oslo.config>=1.2.0a3' \
       python-keystoneclient
  $> pip freeze | grep oslo.config
  oslo.config-1.2.0a3
  $> python -c 'from oslo.config.cfg import DeprecatedOpt'

This is actually exactly the semantics we want and we go to great
lengths in pbr to get these semantics while using a single tarball URL.
The only downside to this --find-links strategy is that we gain an extra
line in our requirements.txt ... but it does work around the pip bug.

Change-Id: I6f3eb5fd2c75615d9a1cae172aed859b36b27d4c

commit_message:
Fix grammar errors in network admin guide

As noted by Dianne in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34576
there were a couple of places in the network admin guide
that could use a grammar fix. To avoid hassling the original
commiter, I submit them here for review.

Change-Id: I970642d9ff4c7f0cb247dca2c92438425e659400

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 18:02:56.000000000', 'message': 'Bug # 1130868 - Updated package-based client installation steps.

- Added instructions regarding the use of RHEL packages.
- Corrected prompts in a number of places where root was assumed but
  "normal" prompt was displayed.
- Switched programlisting elements to screen because:
  * It's semantically correct, these aren't scripts.
  * The inclusion of the prompt character throws off the color syntax
    highlighter due to the presence of the prompt character (# being the
    comment character and $ the variable marker in bash).
- Made it clearer in package-based installation steps that there are
  clients other than nova available.
- Added a note to highlight that it's not necessary to install the
  clients using pip if you already used the distribution packages. In
  future probaly require two procedures rather than having distribution
  packages strewn throughout the prerequisites.

Change-Id: I7a1d041d92b9c74a860def6a15bc10e6c46cf589
Fixes: bug 1130868
'}]
commit_message:
Bug # 1130868 - Updated package-based client installation steps.

- Added instructions regarding the use of RHEL packages.
- Corrected prompts in a number of places where root was assumed but
  "normal" prompt was displayed.
- Switched programlisting elements to screen because:
  * It's semantically correct, these aren't scripts.
  * The inclusion of the prompt character throws off the color syntax
    highlighter due to the presence of the prompt character (# being the
    comment character and $ the variable marker in bash).
- Made it clearer in package-based installation steps that there are
  clients other than nova available.
- Added a note to highlight that it's not necessary to install the
  clients using pip if you already used the distribution packages. In
  future probaly require two procedures rather than having distribution
  packages strewn throughout the prerequisites.

Change-Id: I7a1d041d92b9c74a860def6a15bc10e6c46cf589
Fixes: bug 1130868

commit_message:
Bug # 1200325 - Updated CLI references from Quantum to Neutron

Updated all instances of Quantum in the CLI guide to Neutron. Added a
brief note in the overview under the table listing the clients to
indicate that the "neutron" client was previously known as "quantum".

Change-Id: I6ee94f4f56865d357ed1c1b11384f2a17c7c7cc9
Fixes: bug 1200325

commit_message:
Restart rabbitmq-server in case of failure

RabbitMQ is a critical service in our system and should therefore
be restarted in case of failure. No logs will be lost as they can be
recovered from systemd journal.

Change-Id: If5416ecc636e199d639be2c6bb8777326e7ea659

commit_message:
Remove merge conflict markers from xsds & update targetNamespace

common.xsd has some merge conflict markers probably due to
some whitespace changes that some inadvertantly committed.
Also, Oxygen complains when the targetNamespaces aren't consistent
and according to Jorge Williams they should all remain at v1.1 even
for v2 api since the schema has remained the same.

Change-Id: I0d5aab4cc9a1eb9a1906d514b0058b1ac8e4958b

commit_message:
Minor changes to make wadl valid

Removing targetNamespace (that's an xsd thing) and removing
"(Optional)" from a param name and instead setting required="false"
for that param.

Change-Id: I8ec3d8d2daff58785fec9902f5664a234cddcd69

commit_message:
Incorrectly mocked search results

Replaced `::Chef::Search::Query` with `search`.  Search only returns
an array of nodes.

Change-Id: I9280a066eb182f1d50bf4f641f9516fd47f7cabf

commit_message:
Transformer to convert between units.

Partially addresses BP transformer-unit

Provide a new transformer to apply scaling conversions, either
replacing or emitted in addition to the original sample.

The target counters are identified either by name or by unit.

The scaling can be expressed as either a straight multiplicative
factor or as a string expression to be eval'd.

Configured as per usual via the pipeline.yaml, for example:

    ...
    transformers:
        - name: "unit_conversion"
          parameters:
              source:
                  unit: "°C"
              target:
                  unit: "°F"
                  scale: "(volume * 1.8) + 32"
              replace: True

Change-Id: I4c3f64376c6f994afd0b1a25dc399daabe2a2ec5

commit_message:
Change search role for memcache services

Use role os-infra-caching for the definition of the memcache service location
instead of infra-caching

Change-Id: Ia8f24a330e737ae0592d3e469c1d0c1bf496eebc

Hmm, I'm not sure how I feel about this patch... I mean, is this a bug in XenServer and Hyper-V regarding the VHD disk image sizing? If it is, I'd prefer to pull the offending assertion out into a separate test case and add a SkipTest to it that references the bug in Launchpad."}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-07-08 07:52:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Jay - I have a question, maybe I don't get something: So let's say the image's minDisk value is 1G. You fire up an instance from that image, with a flavor providing 2G disk. If you create an image from your instance, what is the expected minDisk value?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-07-09 20:20:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Mate, sorry for the late reply (was on holiday...).

I would expect that the minDisk made from the instance would be 1GB, since that is what the original image's specification was. The flavor's 2GB ephemeral disk should not affect the bas image's minimum disk requirement, right?

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-10 04:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The original image was uploaded without a minDisk parameter.

The disk will be expanded to the flavor size on boot.

After the expansion the snapshot will contains a disk which size equals to the size in the flavor size. Seams logical to specify the flavor size as minDisk size. IMHO the snapshoting should work in this way with all disk types.

I would not remove the assertion, I would check is the minDisk in the expected set (old and new behavior, not an interval). (-1)'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-07-10 09:50:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Okay, I will modify the test according to Attila's comments."}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-07-10 16:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 20:00:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-07-05 17:09:25.000000000', 'message': "Disable minDisk checking

If a new image is created from an instance, it is expected that the new
image's minDisk is the same as the original images. This is not valid
with VHD files. See the bug description for a link to a unit test that
proves this.

Fixes bug 1198265

Change-Id: I59ecb79c933e44b4a9f2d565e050a8f9fd9ac767
"}, {'created': '2013-07-10 16:07:53.000000000', 'message': "improve minDisk checking

If a new image is created from an instance, it is expected that the new
image's minDisk is the same as the original images. This is not valid
with at least with VHD images. See the bug description for a link to a
unit test that proves this. This patch checks if the minDisk is either
the original minDisk or the disk size of the flavor.

Fixes bug 1198265

Change-Id: I59ecb79c933e44b4a9f2d565e050a8f9fd9ac767

commit_message:
improve minDisk checking

If a new image is created from an instance, it is expected that the new
image's minDisk is the same as the original images. This is not valid
with at least with VHD images. See the bug description for a link to a
unit test that proves this. This patch checks if the minDisk is either
the original minDisk or the disk size of the flavor.

Fixes bug 1198265

Change-Id: I59ecb79c933e44b4a9f2d565e050a8f9fd9ac767

commit_message:
Update NVP plugin name for Neutron.

Module nicira_nvp_plugin no longer exists and it can be removed from
the plugin name.

Supports blueprint nicira_nvp_plugin

Change-Id: I19bdbb3c9e7aa05f672789766f3c0fd528682f03

subject: Make compute_api.get() use objects natively

commit_message:
Make compute_api.get() use objects natively

This finishes what a previous patch started, which makes get()
query instance objects directly.

Most of the change in this patch is just accounting for minor
differences in the unit tests.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: Ib8346bcd5a57279a8f6d57adc621910f67ef1b53

subject: Workaround for olso-config problems.
messages:
[{'account_id': 4277, 'date': '2013-07-09 16:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-09 17:10:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The "right" fix for this is in process in the openstack-infra/config project as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36128/

When that lands, we'll need to include the link to the tarball but *without the version number* in our requirements.txt.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-09 17:11:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Yeah, that's cool as a workaround documentation but I don't think we should merge. Thanks Sandy! :)"}, {'account_id': 4277, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:52:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

FWIW, the change to requirements.txt was done to nova.   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35281/1/requirements.txt'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-11 11:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I wonder why they include oslo-config and still load the tarball? Perhaps the first sets up the _download directory and the second defeats the metadata bug?'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-11 17:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

apparently this patch was unacceptable, but the other branch that did pretty much the same thing was fine.'}]
