"}]
commit_message:
Sync latest rpc changes from oslo-incubator

Includes these commits:

 3006787 Sanitize passwords in _safe_log
 c37f6aa Add support for heartbeating in the kombu RPC driver
 323e465 Add conditional exception reraise
 dea334a Replace sys.exit by a RPCException
 719eba4 Don't reconnect to exclusive fanout consumers.
 22ec8ff Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust
 13650b1 rpc: remove some unused serialization code
 e204885 Optionally reject messages on exception.
 688832f Remove unused zmq relay functionality

Change-Id: I8629c271bc00571783f9b77ec36034945df9a583

commit_message:
Bug #1198286 provider router demo is confusing

Change router ownership to the provider tenant.
Use more descriptive names for the tenants.
Clarify which users/tenants are doing what.
Note that the router can connect more networks from other tenants.
Simplify net-create by removing provider attribute parameters.
Made editorial changes - diane fleming

Change-Id: I89cc707ac815ed06e3dc648208fe4fb2008a802d

commit_message:
enable v2 api hbase tests

- update hbase connection to use in memory connection
- change so we always retrieve table from connection rather than
using obj variable to ensure we're using correct reference
- various fixes to get hbase to behave according to tests

Change-Id: Ie856654b94f1db8e1e4a5d8fcca56631a9726665

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-28 16:13:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add Instance.get_by_id() query method

This adds the ability to fetch instances by id (instead of just
by uuid). In order to do that, the following additional changes
were made:

1. Refactor the get_by_uuid() method to share more code, and
   also fix its use of a kwarg as a positional one
2. Add columns_to_join as a parameter to db.instance_get()

Note that #1 above required a bunch of trivial changes to the
existing instance tests for the new calling mechanism.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I83eb55c363062a3506c7f5dfa161d8072865f11d

commit_message:
Add Instance.get_by_id() query method

This adds the ability to fetch instances by id (instead of just
by uuid). In order to do that, the following additional changes
were made:

1. Refactor the get_by_uuid() method to share more code, and
   also fix its use of a kwarg as a positional one
2. Add columns_to_join as a parameter to db.instance_get()

Note that #1 above required a bunch of trivial changes to the
existing instance tests for the new calling mechanism.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I83eb55c363062a3506c7f5dfa161d8072865f11d

commit_message:
Fix problems when running pecan serve config.py

To avoid exception when running pecan serve config.py
under api/, we need to import _ before use them.

Change-Id: I34a949d597858f4116ffdaa709439968abc5dd90

- http://logs.openstack.org/33723/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/11581 : FAILURE in 40m 39s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-06-21 22:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2013-07-03 18:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

sounds great!'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-07-08 13:27:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Finally!

Small question:

Is there a reason why we can't let eventlet pick it up for us?"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-07-08 18:20:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Flavio!

I am with you--I don't understand why we wouldn't have let eventlet pick it for us. However, I was worried when making the change about losing the legacy behavior of having poll as the default. Does that make sense? Maybe I could make a possible value or alternate configuration setting that indicates that eventlet should choose?"}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-07-09 00:09:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My vote is for another configuration setting telling eventlet to choose.  Further, what about falling back to select if the exception thrown and logging a warning?'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-07-09 09:14:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think allowing None value in that config parameter is good enough. It'll basically let eventlet choose whatever hub is works better for this process. 

I think the reason why it wasn't like that in first place is because most of this code was taken from other projects. I changed that behavior in Swift (or Nova? Can't remember) and added support for other hubs. Here's an explanation why poll is enforced instead of epoll.

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/utils.py#L981

Notice that when select is not found, it returns None which is later passed to:

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/wsgi.py#L207

Cheers,
FF"}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-07-10 22:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 22:16:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-11 00:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Some platforms do not support the 'poll' hub.

commit_message:
Do not create LDAP Domains sub tree

Since we do not support multiple domains in LDAP, creating Domains sub tree is
unnecessary and confusing.

Fixes Bug1194204

Change-Id: Ie340fe00bd57675afda58318d858ad2089a17a29

commit_message:
xenapi: glance plugin should close connections

Current the xenapi glance plugin does not close
httplib connections when exceptions are raised.

Note this code is run under python 2.4 so with
is not available.

Fixes bug 1197846

Change-Id: I5cfb067320e7506109c301532a95fe83aa4fd0f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 22:44:00.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly disassociate fixed ip that is not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Ibe88c9bd2e090ba2ff42344564387b7e2b93e649
(cherry picked from commit 9c6187a8537333bea0886f5f058784d0a0a6705e)
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly disassociate fixed ip that is not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Ibe88c9bd2e090ba2ff42344564387b7e2b93e649
(cherry picked from commit 9c6187a8537333bea0886f5f058784d0a0a6705e)

commit_message:
Use python json.loads to parse tenant id.

Previous method involving awk and cut was faulty and
wound up uploading images to glance with a timestamp for
the tenant ID.

Hi all.  I understand that the number of lines changed is large, but the lines in the test file are mostly text, and the driver code change is straightforward.  This patch solves a significant issue, has been tested well, and has been peer-reviewed.  We come up with a new smaller patch that solves the issue with less lines of code, but will be less readable, more bug-prone, and less tested and reviewed.  Isn't this more risky?"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-05-16 07:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-05-16 07:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I still think this patch is invasive and shouldn't be backported.

The driver introduces 142 lines of code and removes 57, plus, CLIResponse lacks of docstrings explaining how it works. (I know that a couple of methods are just magic methods being overridden).

Also, The test case seems a bit small to me and introduces an ifmain at the bottom that shouldn't be there.

Hopefully this can be addressed with a smaller patch.

Thanks for submitting this."}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-05-16 09:43:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

While I don't disagree with some of the earlier comments, and the changes are still a bit hard to follow IMO.  The bottom line is that this is *your* driver, and the change is limited to your driver.  As I result I defer a lot of the judgement here to you as you have a much deeper knowledge of what's safe and what the trade-offs and risks are.

I suppose if this doesn't go through the only other option is require your customers to upgrade their firmware."}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-07-03 06:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The patch is significantly more simple now - from 249 to 100 LOC'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2013-07-10 17:07:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

I'd second John that its your driver so your responsibility, I'd just like to clarify one thing:
Flavio had concerns about introducing CLIResponse class in the backport, but is it really better now with its copy/paste?
This reduced LOC but if future backports would require CLIResponse, then it'd be better to just add it now.
Flavio, please re-review latest patch set and let us know.

Avishay, do you think CLIResponse will be used in the future backports?"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-07-10 17:31:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Fix incompatible Storwize/SVC commands.

Inconsistencies in the command line syntax between Storwize/SVC
models and firmware versions caused driver failures. This patch
makes commands compatible to fix driver crashes on the V3700 and
controllers with firmware version 6.3.

Cherry-picked from f38f943899ea95fe237be1d096ceafd35b57a843

Change-Id: I51d5b97afa5419cdbf488f9e4e4597d22bb22f20
Fixes: bug 1163754
Fixed: bug 1163964

commit_message:
Change check-detach to reject more states

Change check_detach is reject anything other than 'in-use', rather than
just rejecting 'available'.

Fixes bug #1199922

Change-Id: I3180540ca7bb699a3494ca4eea1389ae8a117df0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-10 12:01:59.000000000', 'message': 'New flag to handle the disk driver for libvirt and Xen.

There are two versions of the blktap [1] driver available under Xen.
blktap1 has been replaced by blktap2 that does not support "tap"
devices but "tap2", therefore we should use "tap2" devices by default.

This change adds support for this but also lets the user to select the
old "blktap" driver if they are using still an old version, or even the
"file" driver directly.

Fixes bug 1188517
Fixes bug 1084618
DocImpact

Change-Id: I8b46885b0909de7cb51fd2d0f6ba2e9bcbf33cc6

commit_message:
Select disk driver for libvirt+Xen according to the Xen version

There are two versions of the blktap [1] driver available under Xen.
blktap1 has been replaced by blktap2 that does not support "tap"
devices but "tap2", therefore we should use "tap2" devices by default.

Fixes bug 1188517
Fixes bug 1084618
DocImpact

Change-Id: I8b46885b0909de7cb51fd2d0f6ba2e9bcbf33cc6

commit_message:
Add FileInclude special type.

We need to be able to combine pieces without uploading bits to an
accessible URL.

Change-Id: If0cec8ce7c77fed786d54dd0af2eb7823c088920

commit_message:
openapproved: ignore patches with a negative VRIF

In addition to ignoring patches with a negative review, ignore patches
that fail jenkins tests. As a negative VRIF implies the patch isn't
ready to be approved again.

Clarify docstring, to point trying to identify trivial rebases only.

Change-Id: I812ad787cf6aa06d1ea05b2a0b70574b907b8777
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/36416
Approved: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Reviewed-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins
